uhh uhh uhh you ready b? let us go get  them look for me, young b cruisin' down the westside, highway doing what we like to do our way eyes behind shades, this necklace the reason all of my dates been blind dates but today i got my thoroughest girl with me i am mashin' the gas, she is grabbin' the wheel it is true to the heart she rides with me, the new bobby and whitney only time we do not speak is during "sex and the city" she gets carrie fever but soon as the show is over she is right back to being my soldier because mami's a rider and i am a roller put us together, how they gon' stop both us? what ever she lacks, i am right over her shoulder when i am off track mami is keepin' me focused so let us lock this down like it is supposed to be the '03 bonnie and clyde, hov' and b, holler all i need in this life of sin, is me and my girlfriend (me and my girlfriend) down to ride 'til the very end, it is me and my boyfriend (me and my boyfriend) the problem is, you dudes treat the one that you loving with the same respect that you treat the one that you humpin' now they 'bout nothing, if ever you mad about something it will not be that, oh no, it will not be that i do not be at places where we comfy at with no bi-atch, oh no, you will not see that and no, i are not perfect, nobody walkin' this earth's surface is but girlfriend, work with the kid i keep you workin' at hermès, birkin bag manolo blahnik, timbs, aviator lens 600 drops, mercedes benz the only time you wear burberry to swim and i do not have to worry, only worry is him she do anything necessary for him and i do anything necessary for her so do not let the necessary occur, yep (talk to  them b), if i was your girlfriend i will be there for you, if somebody hurts you even if that somebody was me (that is right!) yeah-hee (break it down for  them, b!) sometimes i trip on how happy we could have been and so i put this on my life nobody or nothing will ever come between us and i promise i will give my life all of my trust if you was my boyfriend (one more time) put this on my life the air that i breathe in, all that i believe in i promise i will give my life all of my trust if you was my boyfriend

you wastin' your talent, randy! yeah, ready? it is like i am paranoid, lookin' over my back it is like a whirlwind inside of my head it is like i can not stop what i am hearing within it is like the face inside is right come on! why does it feel like night today? something in here is not right today why am i so uptight today? paranoia's all i got left i do not know what stressed me first or how the pressure was fed but i know just what it feels like to have a voice in the back of my head it is like a face that i hold inside a face that awakes when i close my eyes a face that watches everytime they lie a face that laughs everytime they fall (and watches everything) so, i know that when it is time to sink or swim that face inside is hearing me right underneath my skin you know i thug  them, fuck  them, love  them, leave  them because i do not fuckin' need  them take  them out the hood, keep  them lookin' good but i do not fuckin' feed  them first time they fuss i am breezin' talkin' 'bout, "what is the reasons?" i am a pimp in every sense of the word, bitch better trust than believe  them in the cut where i keep  them 'til i need a nut, 'til i need to beat the guts then it is, "beep beep" and i am pickin'  them up let  them play with the dick in the truck many chicks want to put jigga fist in cuffs divorce him and split his bucks just because you got good head, i'ma break bread so you can be livin' it up? shit, i parts with nothing, you all be frontin' me give my heart to a woman? not for nothing, never happen i will be forever mackin' heart cold as assassins, i got no passion i got no patience and i hate waitin' ho get yo' ass in and let us ri-i-i-i-i-ide check  them out now ri-i-i-i-i-ide, yeah let us ri-i-i-i-i-ide we doing big pimpin', we spendin' cheese big pimpin', on b.l.a.d.'s we doing big pimpin' up in nyc it is just that jigga man, pimp c, and b-you-n-b (yo, yo, yo!) big pimpin', spendin' cheese we doing big pimpin', on b.l.a.d.'s it is just that jigga man, pimp c, and b-you-n-b (b-b)

yeah yeah, i am out that brooklyn, now i am down in tribeca right next to de niro, but i will be hood forever i am the new sinatra, and since i made it here i can make it anywhere, yeah, they love me everywhere i used to cop in harlem, hola, my dominicanos right there up on broadway, brought me back to that mcdonald's took it to my stash spot, 560 state street catch me in the kitchen, like a simmons whippin' pastry cruisin' down 8th street, off-white lexus drivin' so slow, but bk is from texas me? i am out that bed-stuy, home of that boy biggie now i live on billboard and i brought my boys with me say what up to ty-ty, still sippin' mai tais sittin' courtside, knicks and nets give me high fives nigga, i be spiked out, i could trip a referee tell by my attitude that i am most definitely from in new york (ayy, aha) (uh, yeah) concrete jungle (yeah) where dreams are made of there is nothing you can not do (yeah) (okay) now you are in new york (aha, aha, aha) (uh, yeah) these streets will make you feel brand-new (new) big lights will inspire you (come on) (okay) let us hear it for new york (you are welcome, og) (come on) new york (yeah), new york (uh) (i made you hot, nigga) catch me at the x with og at a yankee game shit, i made the yankee hat more famous than a yankee can you should know i bleed blue, but i are not a crip, though but i got a gang of niggas walkin' with my clique though welcome to the meltin' pot, corners where we sellin' rock afrika bambaataa shit, home of the hip-hop yellow cab, gypsy cab, dollar cab, holla back for foreigners it are not fair, they act like they forgot how to add eight million stories out there in the naked city, it is a pity half of you all will not make it me? i got to plug special ed "i got it made" if jeezy's payin' lebron, i am payin' dwyane wade three dice cee lo, three card monte labor day parade – rest in peace, bob marley statue of liberty, long live the world trade long live the king, yo – i am from the empire state, that is in new york (ayy) (uh, yeah) concrete jungle where dreams are made of there is nothing you can not do (that boy good) (okay) now you are in new york (uh, yeah) (welcome to the bright light, baby) these streets will make you feel brand-new big lights will inspire you (okay) let us hear it for new york (come on) new york (yeah), new york (uh) lights is blinding, girls need blinders so they can step out of bounds quick, the side lines is lined with casualties who sip the life casually then gradually become worse – do not bite the apple, eve! caught up in the in-crowd, now you are in-style and when winter gets cold, en vogue with your skin out the city of sin is a pity on a whim good girls gone bad, the city's filled with them mami, took a bus trip, now she got her bust out everybody ride her, just like a bus route "hail mary" to the city, you are a virgin and jesus can not save you, life starts when the church ends came here for school, graduated to the high life ball players, rap stars, addicted to the limelight mdma got you feelin' like a champion the city never sleeps, better slip you a ambien in new york (ayy, ah) (uh, yeah) there is nothing you can not do (okay) one hand in the air for the big city street lights, big dreams, all lookin' pretty no place in the world that could compare put your lighters in the air, everybody say "yeah, yeah" (come on) in new york (uh, yeah)

bloody murder, murder murder the paper read murder black on black murder this is to the memory of danroy henry too much enemy fire to catch a friendly strays from the same shade nigga we on the same team giving you respect i expect the same thing all black everything nigga you know my fresh code i am out here fightin' for you do not increase my stress load niggas watchin' the throne very happy to be power to the people when you see me, see you and i am from the murder capital where they murder for capital heard about at least 3 killings this afternoon lookin' at the news like damn i was just with him after school no shop class but half the school got a tool and i could die any day type attitude plus his little brother got shot reppin' his avenue it is time for us to stop and re-define black power 41 souls murdered in 50 hours black on black murder again murder again... is it genocide? because i can still hear his momma cry know the family traumatized shots left holes in his face bout piranha-size the old pastor closed the cold casket and said the church are not got enough room for all the tombs it is a war going on outside we are not safe from i feel the pain in my city wherever i go 314 sol¬diers died in iraq 509 died in chicago i arrived on the day fred hampton died real niggas just multiply and they say 21 i was supposed to die so i am out here celebratin' my post demise if you put crabs in a barrel to insure your survival you gon' end up pulling down niggas that look just like you what up blood? what up cuz? it is all black i love us it is a celebration of black excellence black tie, black maybachs black excellence, opulence, decadence tuxes next to the president, i am present i dress in dries and other boutique stores in paris in sheepskin coats, i silence the lamb do you know who i am clarice? no cheap cologne whenever i shh-shh success never smelled so sweet i stink of success the new black elite they say my black card bear the mark of the beast i repeat my religion is the beat my is like church my jesus piece now please, domino, domino, only spot a few blacks the higher i go what is up to will shoutout to o that are not enough we gon need a million more kick in the door biggie flow i am all dressed up with nowhere to go yea it is all messed up when it is nowhere to go so we will not take the time out til we reach the t o p from paroles to hold g's, sold keys, low keys we like the promised land of the og's in the past if you picture events like a black tie what the last thing you expect to see, black guys what is the life expectancy for black guys? the system's working effectively, that is why i will be a real man and take care of your son every problem you had before this day is now done new crib, watch a movie because are not nothin on the news but the blues hit the mall, pick up some gucci now are not nothin new but your shoes sunday morning praise the lord you the girl that jesus had been saving me for so let us savor this moment and take it to the floor black excellence truly yours

you take the clothes off my back, and i let you you steal the food right out of my mouth and i watch you eat it, i still do not know why why our love is so much ohhh you curse my name, in spite to put me to shame have my laundry in the streets, dirty or clean give it up for fame but i still do not know why why i love it so much yeah and baby, it is amazing i am in this maze with you i just can not crack your code one day you screaming you love me loud the next day you are so cold one day you here, one day you there, one day you care you are so unfair sipping from the cup till it runneth over, (uh, uh) holy grail uh, blue told me remind you niggas uh, fuck that shit you all talk about, i am the nigga uh, caught up in all these lights and cameras, uh but look what that shit did to hammer, uh goddamnit, i like it the bright lights is enticing but look what it did to tyson all that money in one night, 30 mill for one fight but soon as all the money blows, all the pigeons take flight fuck the fame, keep cheating on me what i do, i took her back, fool me twice, that is my bad i can not even blame her for that enough to make me want to murder momma please just get my bail i know nobody to blame, kurt cobain, i did it to myself, uh and we all just entertainers and were stupid, and contagious one day you are screaming you love me loud sipping from the cup, till it runneth over, holy grail now i got tattoos on my body psycho bitches in my lobby i got haters in the paper, photo shoots with paparazzi can not even take my daughter for a walk see them by the corner store i feel like i am cornered off enough is enough, i am calling this off who the fuck i am kidding though? i am getting high, sitting low sliding by in that big body curtains all in my window this fame hurts, but this chain works i think back, you asked the same person if this is all you had to deal with nigga deal with it, this shit are not work, this light work camera snapping, my eyes hurt niggas dying back where i was birthed fuck your iris and irs get the hell up off of your high horse you got the shit that niggas die for, dry yours why you mad, take the good with the bad do not throw that baby out with the bath water you are still alive still that nigga, nigga you survived you still getting bigger nigga, living the life, vanilla wafers in a villa illest nigga alive, michael jackson thriller one day you  are screaming you love me loud you get the air out my lungs, whenever you need it and you would take the blade right out my heart, so you can watch me bleed and i still do not know why (do not know why) why i love you so much, and you play this game, in spite to drive me insane i got it tattooed on my sleeve, forever in ink with guess who is name but i still do not know why (do not know why) why i love it so much, yeah the next day you are so cold (do not know why)

if you are having girl problems i feel bad for you son i got ninety nine problems but a bitch are not one i got the rap patrol on the gat patrol foes that want to make sure my casket's closed rap critics that say he is "money cash hoes" i am from the hood, stupid what type of facts are those if you grew up with holes in your zapatos you would celebrate the minute you was having dough i am like "fuck critics" you can kiss my whole asshole if you do not like my lyrics, you can press fast forward got beef with radio if i do not play they show they do not play my hits, well, i do not give a shit, so rap mags try and use my black ass so advertisers can give  them more cash for ads, fuckers i do not know what you take me as or understand the intelligence that jay-z has i am from rags to riches, niggas i are not dumb i got ninety nine problems but a bitch are not one, hit me ninety nine problems but a bitch are not one if you having girl problems i feel bad for you son year's '94 and my trunk is raw in my rear view mirror is the motherfucking law i got two choices you all, pull over the car or, hmm, bounce on the devil, put the pedal to the floor now i are not trying to see no highway chase with jake plus i got a few dollars i could fight the case so i, pull over to the side of the road i heard "son, do you know why i am stopping you for?" because i am young and i am black and my hat's real low or do i look like a mind reader, sir? i do not know am i under arrest or should i guess some mo? song: I Just Called to Say I Love You
lyrics: no new year's day to celebrate no chocolate covered candy hearts to give away no first of spring, no song to sing in fact, here's just another ordinary day no april rain, no flowers bloom no wedding saturday within the month of june but what it is, is something true made up of these three words that i must say to you i just called to say i love you i just called to say how much i care and i mean it from the bottom of my heart no summer's high, no warm july no harvest moon to light one tender august night no autumn breeze, no falling leaves not even time for birds to fly to southern skies no libra sun, no halloween no giving thanks to all the christmas joy you bring but what it is, though old, so new to fill your heart like no three words could ever do i just called to say how much i care, i do of my heart (of my heart) baby, of my heart

song: I Believe When I Fall in Love It Will Be Forever

when i was young, i prayed for lightning my mother said it would come and find me i found myself without a prayer i lost my love and no one cared yeah, i looked with my face up to the sky, but i saw nothing there no, no, nothing there yeah, i stared while my eyes filled up with tears, but there was nothing there no, no, nothing i heard one sine from above (ooh) then the signal split in two the sound created stars like me and you before there was love, there was silence i heard one sine and it healed my heart, heard a sine healed my heart, heard a sine when i was young, i felt immortal and not a day went by without a struggle i lived my days just for the nights i lost myself under the lights healed my heart healed my heart, heart sine heart, heard a sine

song: I m Gonna Love Me Again
lyrics: oh, the joke was never hard to tell threw my fair change in the wishing well the dream alone is always in your hands if that do not fill the boy and build the man a heart has many secrets, so i am told through the years a theory can grow cold i am up to be the king, it is gotten clear the voice inside my head is the one i hear singing i am going to love me again check in on my very best friend find the wind to fill my sails rise above the broken rails unbound by any ties that break or bend i am free, and do not you know? no clown that claimed he used to know me then and oh-oh-oh, i am going to love me again the golden age was somehow bittersweet but now the past lies sleeping in the deep the peaceful days that followed hollow nights a kiss or touch could feel like kryptonite praise the saints that hung up on my wall for trust is left in lovers after all a whispered word emerging from a tale my wake up call to claim the cursed spell and i am going to love me again sing i am going to love me again and oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh oh-oh-oh, i am going to love me again i am going to love me again

song: Don t Let the Sun Go Down on Me
lyrics: i can not light no more of your darkness all my pictures seem to fade to black and white i am growing tired and time stands still before me frozen here on the ladder of my life too late to save myself from falling i took a chance and changed your way of life but you misread my meaning when i met you close the door and left me blind by the light do not let the sun go down on me although i search myself it is always someone else i see i would just allow a fragment of your life to wander free by losing everything is like the sun going down on me i can not find oh the right romantic line but see me once and see the way i feel do not discard me just because you think i mean you harm but these cuts i have oh they need love to help them heal to wander free, yeah
life is not everything

song: Rocket Man I Think It s Going to Be a Long Long Time
lyrics: she packed my bags last night pre-flight zero hour nine am and i am going to be high as a kite by then i miss the earth so much i miss my wife it is lonely out in space on such a timeless flight and i think it is going to be a long long time 'till touch down brings me round again to find i am not the man they think i am at home oh no no no i am a rocket man rocket man burning out his fuse up here alone mars are not the kind of place to raise kids in fact it is cold as hell and there is no one there to raise them if you did and all this science i do not understand it is just my job five days a week a rocket man, a rocket man

is this the real life? is this just fantasy? caught in a landslide no escape from reality open your eyes look up to the skies and see i am just a poor boy, i need no sympathy because i am easy come, easy go a little high, little low anyway the wind blows, does not really matter to me, to me mama, just killed a man put a gun against his head pulled my trigger, now he is dead mama, life had just begun but now i have gone and thrown it all away mama, ooo did not mean to make you cry if i am not back again this time tomorrow carry on, carry on, as if nothing really matters too late, my time has come sends shivers down my spine body's aching all the time goodbye everybody - i have got to go got to leave you all behind and face the truth mama, ooo - (anyway the wind blows) i do not want to die i sometimes wish i would never been born at all i see a little silhouetto of a man scaramouch, scaramouch will you do the fandango thunderbolt and lightning - very very frightening me gallileo, gallileo, gallileo figaro - magnifico but i am just a poor boy and nobody loves me he is just a poor boy from a poor family spare him his life from this monstrosity easy come easy go - will you let me go bismillah! no - we will not let you go - let him go bismillah! we will not let you go - let him go bismillah! we will not let you go - let me go will not let you go - let me go (never) never let you go - let me go never let me go - ooo no, no, no, no, no, no, no - oh mama mia, mama mia, mama mia let me go beelzebub has a devil put aside for me for me so you think you can stone me and spit in my eye so you think you can love me and leave me to die oh baby - can not do this to me baby just got to get out - just got to get right outta here ooh yeah, ooh yeah nothing really matters anyone can see nothing really matters - nothing really matters to me anyway the wind blows...

song: I Guess That s Why They Call It the Blues
lyrics: do not wish it away do not look at it like it is forever between you and me i could honestly say that things can only get better and while i am away dust out the demons inside and it will not be long before you and me run to the place in our hearts where we hide and i guess that is why they call it the blues time on my hands could be time spent with you laughin' like children, livin' like lovers rollin' like thunder under the covers just stare into space picture my face in your hands live for each second without hesitation and never forget i am your man wait on me girl cry in the night if it helps but more than ever i simply love you more than i love life itself wait on me, girl but more than ever, i simply love you (laughing like children, living like lovers)

i saw you dancin' out the ocean running fast along the sand a spirit born of earth and water fire flying from your hands in the instant that you love someone in the second that the hammer hits reality runs up your spine and the pieces finally fit and all i ever needed was the one like freedom fields where wild horses run when stars collide like you and i no shadows block the sun you are all i have ever needed babe, you are the one there are caravans we follow drunken nights in dark hotels when chances breathe between the silence when sex and love no longer gel for each man in his time is cain until he walks along the beach and sees his future in the water a long lost heart within his reach ooh babe, you are the one

it is a little bit funny this feeling inside i am not one of those who can easily hide i do not have much money, but boy if i did i would buy a big house where we both could live if i was a sculptor, ha but then again, no or a man who makes potions in a traveling show i know it is not much, but it is the best i can do my gift is my song, and this one's for you and you can tell everybody this is your song it may be quite simple, but now that it is done i hope you do not mind that i put down in words how wonderful life is while you are in the world i sat on the roof and kicked off the moss well a few of the verses, well they have got me quite cross but the sun's been quite kind while i wrote this song it is for people like you that keep it turned on so excuse me forgetting but these things i do you see i have forgotten, if they are green or they are blue anyway the thing is, what i really mean yours are the sweetest eyes i have ever seen that i put down in the words

when are you going to come down? when are you going to land? i should have stayed on the farm i should have listened to my old man you know you can not hold me forever i did not sign up with you i am not a present for your friends to open this boy's too young to be singing the blues, aah so goodbye yellow brick road where the dogs of society howl you can not plant me in your penthouse i am going back to my plough back to the howling old owl in the woods hunting the horny back toad oh i have finally decided my future lies beyond the yellow brick road, aah what do you think you will do then? that'll shoot down your plane it will take you a couple of vodka and tonics to set you on your feet again but maybe you will get a replacement there is plenty like me to be found mongrels, who are not got a penny sniffing for tid-bits like you on the ground, aah well i have finally decided my future lies beyond the yellow brick road

i want love, but it is impossible a man like me, so irresponsible a man like me is dead in places other men feel liberated i can not love, shot full of holes do not feel nothing, i just feel cold do not feel nothing, just old scars toughening up around my heart but i want love, just a different kind i want love, will not break me down will not brick me up, will not fence me in i want a love, that do not mean a thing that is the love i want, i want love i want love on my own terms after everything i have ever learned me, i carry too much baggage oh man i have seen so much traffic so bring it on, i have been bruised do not give me love that is clean and smooth i am ready for the rougher stuff no sweet romance, i have had enough i want love, just a different kind i want love will not break me down

song: I Don t Wanna Go On With You Like That
lyrics: i have always said that one's enough to love now i hear you are braggin' one is not enough well, something tells me you are not satisfied you got plans to make me one of four or five i guess this kind of thing's just in your blood but you will not catch me carvin' up my love i are not no puzzle piece that needs to fit if it takes more than me, let us call it quits because i do not want to go on with you like that do not want to be a feather in your cap i just want to tell you, honey, i are not mad but i do not want to go on with you like that oh-oh-oh whoa-oh oh, yeah it gets so hard sometimes to understand this vicious circle's getting out of hand do not need an extra eye to see that the fire spreads faster in a breeze and i do not want to go on with you like that no, i do not want to go on with you like that one more set of boots on your welcome mat you will just have to quit  them if you want me back oh, if you want to spread it around, sister, that is just fine but i do not want no second hand feeding me lines if you want to hold someone in the middle of the night call out the guards, turn out the light i do not want to i do not want to go on with you like that takin' me back

it is a human sign when things go wrong when the scent of her lingers and temptation's strong into the boundary of each married man sweet deceit comes calling and negativity lands cold cold heart hard done by you some things look better, baby just passing through and it is no sacrifice just a simple word it is two hearts living in two separate worlds but it is no sacrifice no sacrifice it is no sacrifice at all mutual misunderstanding after the fact sensitivity builds a prison in the final act we lose direction no stone unturned no tears to damn you when jealousy burns cold, cold heart just passin' through it is two hearts livin' but, it is no sacrifice it is no sacrifice, at all no sacrifice, at all

you could never know what it is like your blood like winter freezes just like ice and there is a cold lonely light that shines from you you will wind up like the wreck you hide behind that mask you use and did you think this fool could never win well look at me, i am coming back again i got a taste of love in a simple way and if you need to know while i am still standing you just fade away do not you know i am still standing better than i ever did looking like a true survivor, feeling like a little kid i am still standing after all this time picking up the pieces of my life without you on my mind i am still standing yeah yeah yeah once i never could hope to win you starting down the road leaving me again the threats you made were meant to cut me down and if our love was just a circus you would be a clown by now you know i am still standing better than i ever did

i remember when rock was young me and suzie had so much fun holding hands and skimming stones had an old gold chevy, and a place of my own but the biggest kick i ever got was doing a thing called the crocodile rock while the other kids were rocking 'round the clock we were hopping and bopping to the crocodile rock well, crocodile rocking is something shocking when your feet just can not keep still i never knew me a better time and i guess i never will oh, lady, mama those friday nights when suzie wore her dresses tight and the crocodile rocking was out of sight laaaaa, la la la la laaaaa, la la la la laaaaa, la la la la laaaaa but the years went by and the rock just died suzie went and left me for some foreign guy long nights crying by the record machine dreaming of my chevy and old blue jeans but they will never kill the thrills we have got burning up to the crocodile rock learning fast as the weeks went past we really thought the crocodile rock would last i never knew me a better time and i guess, i never will crocodile rocking was out of sight had an old gold chevy, and place of my own

dear slim, i wrote you, but you still are not callin' i left my cell, my pager and my home phone at the bottom i sent two letters back in autumn you must not've got  them there probably was a problem at the post office or something sometimes i scribble addresses too sloppy when i jot  them but anyways, f- it, what is been up, man? how is your daughter? my girlfriend's pregnant too, i am 'bout to be a father if i have a daughter, guess what i'ma call her? i'ma name her bonnie i read about your uncle ronnie too, i am sorry i had a friend kill himself over some bitch who did not want him i know you probably hear this every day but i am your biggest fan i even got the underground stuff that you did with skam i got a room full of your posters and your pictures, man i like the stuff you did with rawkus too, that shit was phat anyways, i hope you get this, man, hit me back just to chat, truly yours, your biggest fan, this is stan my tea's gone cold i am wondering why i got out of bed at all the morning rain clouds up my window and i can not see at all and even if i could it would all be gray but your picture on my wall it reminds me that it is not so bad, it is not so bad dear slim, you still are not called or wrote i hope you have a chance i are not mad, i just think it is messed up you do not answer fans if you did not want to talk to me outside the concert you did not have to but you could have signed an autograph for matthew that is my little brother, man, he is only six years old we waited in the blisterin' cold for you for four hours, and you just said no that is pretty crummy, man, you are like his favorite idol he wants to be just like you, man, he likes you more than i do i are not that mad though, i just do not like being lied to remember when we met in denver? you said if i would write you, you would write back see, i am just like you in a way, i never knew my father neither he used to always cheat on my mom and beat her i can relate to what you are sayin' in your songs so when i have a crumby day, i drift away and put  them on because i do not really got shit else so that shit helps when i am depressed i even got a tattoo of your name across the chest sometimes i even cut myself to see how much it bleeds it is like adrenaline, the pain is such a sudden rush for me see, everything you say is real and i respect you because you tell it my girlfriend's jealous because i talk about you 24/7 but she do not know you like i know you, slim, no one does she do not know what it was like for people like us growin' up you got to call me, man i will be the biggest fan you will ever lose, sincerely yours, stan p.s. we should be together too dear mr. i am-too-good-to-call-or-write-my-fans this'll be the last package i ever send your ass it is been six months, and still no word, i do not deserve it? i know you got my last two letters i wrote the addresses on  them perfect so this is my cassette i am sendin' you, i hope you hear it i am in the car right now, i am doing 90 on the freeway hey, slim, i drank a fifth of vodka, you dare me to drive? you know the song by phil collins in the air of the night about that guy who could have saved that other guy from drownin' but did not, then phil saw it all, then at a show he found him? that is kinda how this is you could have rescued me from drownin' now it is too late, i am on a thousand downers now, i am drowsy and all i wanted was a lousy letter or a call i hope you know i ripped all of your pictures off the wall i loved you, slim, we could have been together think about it, you ruined it now i hope you go to sleep and you dream about it and when you dream i hope you can not sleep and you scream about it i hope your conscience eats at you and you can not breathe without me see, slim, shut up, bitch, i am tryin' to talk hey, slim, that is my girlfriend screamin' in the trunk but i did not slit her throat, i just tied her up, see, i are not like you because if she suffocates she will suffer more and then she will die too well, got to go, i am almost at the bridge now oh shoot, i forgot, how am i supposed to send this tape out? dear stan, i meant to write you sooner, but i just been busy you said your girlfriend's pregnant now, how far along is she? look, i am really flattered you would call your daughter that and here's an autograph for your brother, i wrote it on a starter cap i am sorry i did not see you at the show, i must have missed you do not think i did that shit intentionally just to diss you but what is this stuff you said about you like to cut your wrists too? i say that stuff just clownin' dawg come on, how messed up is you? you got some issues, stan, i think you need some counselin' to help your ass from bouncin' off the walls when you get down some and what is this junk about us meant to be together? that type of crap'll make me not want us to meet each other i really think you and your girlfriend need each other or maybe you just need to treat her better i hope you get to read this letter i just hope it reaches you in time before you hurt yourself, i think that you will be doing just fine if you relax a little, i am glad i inspire you but stan, why are you so mad? try to understand that i do want you as a fan i just do not want you to do some crazy i seen this one shit on the news a couple weeks ago that made me sick some dude was drunk and drove his car over a bridge and had his girlfriend in the trunk and she was pregnant with his kid and in the car they found a tape but they did not say who it was to come to think about it, his name was, it was you, damn

goodbye norma jeane though i never knew you at all you had the grace to hold yourself while those around you crawled they crawled out of the woodwork and they whispered into your brain they set you on the treadmill and they made you change your name and it seems to me you lived your life like a candle in the wind never knowing who to cling to when the rain set in and i would have liked to known you but i was just a kid your candle burned out long before your legend ever did loneliness was tough the toughest role you ever played hollywood created a superstar and pain was the price you paid even when you died oh the press still hounded you all the papers had to say was that marilyn was found in the nude from the young man in the twenty second row who sees you as something as more than sexual more than just our marilyn monroe

goodbye england's rose may you ever grow in our hearts you were the grace that placed itself where lives were torn apart you called out to our country and you whispered to those in pain now you belong to heaven and the stars spell out your name and it seems to me you lived your life like a candle in the wind never fading with the sunset when the rain set in and your footsteps will always fall here along england's greenest hills your candle's burned out long before your legend ever will loveliness we have lost these empty days without your smile this torch we will always carry for our nation's golden child and even though we try the truth brings us to tears all our words cannot express the joy you brought us through the years from a country lost without your soul who will miss the wings of your compassion more than you will ever know

from the day we arrive on the planet and blinking, step into the sun there is more to be seen than can ever be seen more to do than can ever be done some say eat or be eaten some say live and let live but all are agreed as they join the stampede you should never take more than you give in the circle of life it is the wheel of fortune it is the leap of faith it is the band of hope till we find our place on the path unwinding in the circle, the circle of life some of us fall by the wayside and some of us soar to the stars and some of us sail through our troubles and some have to live with the scars there is far too much to take in here more to find than can ever be found but the sun rolling high through the sapphire sky keeps great and small on the endless round it is the wheel of fortune, yeah on the path unwinding, yeah

i was unprepared for fame then everybody knew my name no more lonely nights, it is all for you i have travelled many miles i have seen tears and i have seen smiles just remember that it is all for you do not forget me as the colours fade when the lights go down, it is just an empty stage okay yes, i have been a bad guy been higher than the blue sky and the truth is i do not want to die an ordinary man i have made grown men cry do not know why i am still alive yes, the truth is i do not want to die an ordinary man many times i have lost control they tried to kill my rock 'n' roll just remember i am still here for you i do not want to say goodbye when i do, you will be all right after all, i did it all for you

i was told a million times of all the troubles in my way might to grow a little wiser little better every day but if i crossed a million rivers and i rode a million miles then i would still be where i started bread and butter for a smile well, i sold a million mirrors in a shop in alleyway but i never saw my face in any window any day well, they say your folks are telling you to be a superstar but i tell you just be satisfied and stay right where you are keep yourself alive, yeah keep yourself alive it will take you all your time and money but honey, you will survive well, i have loved a million women in a belladonic haze and i ate a million dinners brought to me on silver trays give me everything i need to feed my body and my soul and i will grow a little bigger maybe that can be my goal of all the people in my way how i had to keep on trying and get better ev'ry day same as where i started keep yourself alive, c'mon it will take you all your time and money, honey you will survive shake it keep yourself alive, whoa to keep me satisfied do you think you are better everyday? no, i just think i am two steps nearer to my grave you take your time and take my money to keep yourself alive all you people keep yourself alive keep yourself alive, c'mon, c'mon it will take you all your time and the money take you all your time and money, honey you will survive keep you satisfied

is this the real life? is this just fantasy? caught in a landside no escape from reality open your eyes look up to the skies and see i am just a poor boy, i need no sympathy because i am easy come, easy go little high, little low any way the wind blows does not really matter to me to me mama just killed a man put a gun against his head pulled my trigger now he is dead life had just begun but now i have gone and thrown it all away oooh did not mean to make you cry if i am not back again this time tomorrow carry on, carry on as if nothing really matters too late, my time has come sends shivers down my spine body's aching all the time goodbye, everybody i have got to go got to leave you all behind and face the truth i do not want to die i sometimes wish i would never been born at all i see a little silhouetto of a man scaramouch, scaramouch, will you do the fandango? thunderbolts and lightning, very, very frightening me galileo, galileo galileo, figaro magnifico i am just a poor boy, nobody loves me he is just a poor boy from a poor family spare him his life from this monstrosity easy come, easy go, will you let me go? bismillah! no, we will not let you go (let him go!) bismillah! we will not let you go (let him go!) bismillah! we will not let you go (let me go) will not let you go (let me go) (never) never let you go (let me go) (never) let you go (let me go) ah no, no, no, no, no, no, no oh mama mia, mama mia mama mia, let me go beelzebub has a devil put aside for me for me so you think you can stop me and spit in my eye so you think you can love me and leave me to die oh baby, can not do this to me, baby just got to get out, just got to get right outta here nothing really matters anyone can see nothing really matters to me

i would sit alone and watch your light my only friend through teenage nights and everything i had to know i heard it on my radio you gave them all those old time stars through wars of worlds invaded by mars you made  them laugh, you made  them cry you made us feel like we could fly (radio) so do not become some background noise a backdrop for the girls and boys who just do not know or just do not care and just complain when you are not there you had your time, you had the power you have yet to have your finest hour radio all we hear is radio ga ga radio goo goo radio ga ga radio blah blah radio, what is new? radio, someone still loves you we watch the shows, we watch the stars on videos for hours and hours we hardly need to use our ears how music changes through the years let us hope you never leave, old friend like all good things on you we depend so stick around because we might miss you when we grow tired of all this visual someone still loves you

here we stand or here we fall history will not care at all make the bed light the light lady mercy will not be home tonight yeah you do not waste no time at all do not hear the bell but you answer the call it comes to you as to us all we are just waiting for the hammer to fall oh ev'ry night and every day a little piece of you is falling away but lift your face the western way build your muscles as your body decays yeah toe your line and play their game yeah let the anaesthetic cover it all till one day they call your name you know it is time for the hammer to fall rich or poor or famous for your truth it is all the same (oh no oh no) lock your door the rain is pouring through your window pane (oh no) baby now your struggle's all in vain for we who grew up tall and proud in the shadow of the mushroom cloud convinced our voices can not be heard we just want to scream it louder and louder louder what the hell we fighting for? just surrender and it will not hurt at all you just got time to say your prayers while your waiting for the hammer to hammer to fall it is going to fall hammer, you know, hammer to fall while you are waiting for the hammer to fall give it to me one more time

i do not want to sleep with you i do not need the passion to i do not want a stormy affair to make me feel my life is heading somewhere all i want is the comfort and care just to know that my woman gives me sweet mother love i have walked too long in this lonely lane i have had enough of this same old game i am a man of the world and they say that i am strong but my heart is heavy and my hope is gone out in the city, in the cold world outside i do not want pity, just a safe place to hide mama, please, let me back inside i do not want to make no waves but you can give me all the love that i crave i can not take it if you see me cry i long for peace before i die all i want is to know that you are there you are going to give me all your sweet mother love mother love my body's aching, but i can not sleep my dreams are all the company i keep got such a feeling as the sun goes down i am coming home to my sweet mother love i think i am going back to the things i learnt so well in my youth

i want it all and i want it now adventure seeker on an empty street, just an alley creeper, light on his feet a young fighter screaming, with no time for doubt with the pain and anger can not see a way out, it are not much i am asking, i heard him say, got to find me a future move out of my way, listen all you people, come gather round i got to get me a game plan, got to shake you to the ground just give me what i know is mine, people do you hear me, just give me the sign, it are not much i am asking, if you want the truth here's to the future for the dreams of youth, i am a man with a one track mind, so much to do in one life time (people do you hear me) not a man for compromise and where is and why is and living lies so i am living it all, yes i am living it all, and i am giving it all, and i am giving it all, it are not much i am asking, if you want the truth, here's to the future, hear the cry of youth, and i want it now...

love of my life, you have hurt me you have broken my heart and now you leave me love of my life, can not you see? bring it back, bring it back do not take it away from me because you do not know what it means to me love of my life, do not leave me you have taken my love and now desert me (all my love) bring it back, bring it back (please, bring it back) you will remember when this is blown over and everything's all by the way when i grow older, i will be there at your side to remind you how i still love you i still love you back, hurry back please, bring it back home to me love of my life

i am the invisible man, incredible how you can, see right through me, when you hear a sound, that you just can not place feel something move that you just can not trace, when something sits on the end of your bed do not turn around when you hear me tread. i am the invisible man incredible how you can see right through me it is criminal how i can see right through you. now i am in your room and i am in your bed and i am in your life and i am in your head like the cia or the fbi you will never get close never take me alive see right through you, hah, hah, hah, hello, hah, hah, hah, hello-hello-hello-hello, never had a real good friend - not a boy or a girl no-one knows what i have been through - let my nag unfurl sol make my mark from the edge of the world, from the edge of the world, now i am on your track and i am in your mind, and i am on your back but do not look behind i am your meanest thought i am your darkest fear put i will never get caught you can not shake me, shake me dear, see right through you look at me, look at me

song: My Fairy King BBC Session February 5th 1973 Langham 1 Studio
lyrics: ahh, ahh in the land where horses born with eagle wings and honey bees have lost their stings there is singing forever (ooh, yeah) lions' den with fallow deer and rivers made from wine so clear flow on and on forever (and on and on and on) dragons fly like sparrows thru' the air and baby lambs where samson dares to go on on on on (oh-oh-oh-oh-oh) my fairy king (he rules the air and turns the tides) and can see things that are not there for you and me ooh yeah (too soon) (he guides the winds) he can do right and nothing wrong (ahh) then came man to savage in the night to run like thieves and to kill like knives to take away the power from the magic hand to bring about the ruin to the promised land (ooh, ooh, ooh, ah) they turn the milk into sour like the blue in the blood of my veins (why can not you see it?) fire burnin' in hell with the cry of screaming pain (son of heaven set me free and let me go) sea turns dry no salt from sand seasons fly no helping hand teeth do not shine like pearls for poor men's eyes (no more) someone, someone has drained the color from my wings broken my fairy circle ring and shamed the king in all his pride changed the winds and wronged the tides oh, mother mercury (mercury) look what they have done to me (yeah) i cannot run i cannot hide (oh-oh-oh-oh)

(breakthru) (break-) hey! that would really be a (breakthru)

(alright) i am burning through the sky, yeah i want to make a supersonic man outta you if you want to have a good time just give me a call i do not want to stop at all . la da-da-da-da daah da da da haa ha da-da, ha, ha, haaa ha da daa ha da da aaa(h) ...

song: Spread Your Wings 1977 Rock Show session
lyrics: sammy was low, just watching the show over and over again knew it was time, he would made up his mind to leave his dead life behind his boss said to him, "boy, you would better begin to get those crazy notions right out of your head sammy, who do you think that you are? you should have been sweeping up the emerald bar" spread your wings and fly away fly away, far away spread your little wings and fly away pull yourself together because you know you should do better that is because you are a free man he spends his evenings alone in his hotel room keeping his thoughts to himself, he would be leaving soon wishing he was miles and miles away nothing in this world, nothing would make him stay since he was small, had no luck at all nothing came easy to him now it was time, he would made up his mind "this could be my last chance" his boss said to him, "now listen, boy! you are always dreaming you have got no real ambition, you will not get very far sammy boy, do not you know who you are? why can not you be happy at the emerald bar?" so honey, spread your wings and fly away come on, honey, fly with me

every drop of rain that falls in sahara desert says it all it is a miracle all god's creations great and small the golden gate and the taj mahal that is a miracle test tube babies being born mothers, fathers dead and gone we are having a miracle on earth mother nature does it all for us the wonders of this world go on the hanging gardens of babylon captain cook and cain and abel jimi hendrix to the tower of babel the one thing we are all waiting for is peace on earth, an end to war it is a miracle we need, the miracle the miracle we are all waiting for today if every leaf on every tree could tell a story that would be a miracle if every child on every street had clothes to wear and food to eat if all god's people could be free to live in perfect harmony open hearts and surgery (wonders of this world go on) sunday mornings with a cup of tea super powers always fighting but mona lisa just keeps on smiling (wonders of this world go on) the one thing (the one thing) we are all waiting for (we are all waiting for) is peace on earth (peace on earth) and an end to war (an end to war) the miracle peace on earth and end to war today that time will come one day you will see when we can all be friends

in august, i am staring at rain clouds a descendant of london i watch as people are falling like rain encouraged to seek other options i do not need other options you either eat it or you spit it out you are either silent or you run your mouth you breathe in or you breathe out i am so cold but the sun's up like it is winter all year, oh so welcome you to it now oh, wait, that was my sound could you dig it up or sweat it out? could you give it up and sit down? but after that, i hope you know your place because you just gave me the damn crown and i am going to wear it proud watch me as i wear it now i'mma ride this money like a wave this money like a wave, this money like a wave now i made it this far, but this far are not nothing if we are talking ambition, i think you should know that i do not want to settle for nothing i want to know that i got myself i want to ride my money like a wave my money like a wave, my money like a wave, yeah i want the future, i want the best view i would like to buy all my day ones a house too collie, ben, jodie, i got you i have got a list of everything i would do make that dumb guy regret what he did do then he will be calling up my phone like "i miss you" then i will be like "haha, you can go now because you did not want to know when i told you what you have done to me" something of my life believe that [?] babe i have got god, he is on my side and i am a child of '97 so i plan to be on time and i am ahead of this game yes, i were meant for this life, oh you know i only phone back if i know that it is the money calling tell  them bitches "do not phone back i am in the studio recording" mummy, listen when i am talking mummy, listen, it is important i was not going to tell you, but i thought i would let you know that i just got us both a mortgage now it is top floor with these fancy reservations i do not even like it, i am just here for observations tryna tell the difference from my people and my pagans cuh the last time that i slipped, i had a sticky situation i will never slip again, you can put that on my savings they wait for me to fall, like you have been waiting this feeling is amazing, how does it feel to hate the kid but deep inside, you know you rate him? now that shit must be frustrating

searchin' every corner of my mind lookin' for the answers i can not find i have my reasons and life has its lessons and i tried to be grateful and count all my blessings but heavy is the head that wears the crown amen, in jesus' name, yes i declare it any little seed i receive, i have to share it bruddas want to break me down, i can not bare it but heavy is the head with the crown, i still wear it you can not hold me down, i still cope rain falling down at the brits, i am still soaked tried put a hole in our shit, we will build boats two birds with one stone, i will kill both (what?) pray i never lose and pray i never hit the shelf (two) promise if i do that you will be checkin' on my health (cool) if it is for my people i will do anything to help if i do it out of love it is not to benefit myself, ooh got to stay around but make a comeback too i know my only mother wants her son back too they sayin' i am the voice of the young black youth and then i say "yeah, cool" and then i bun my zoot and now i am searchin' every corner of my mind (search every corner, look for the answers) (no, i can not find  them, no silver lining) i have my reasons and life has its lessons amen, in jesus' name, oh yes i claim it any little bread that i make i have to break it bruddas want to break me down, i can not take it i done a scholarship for the kids, they said it is racist that is not anti-white, it is pro-black hang me out to dry, i will not crack all these fancy ties and gold plaques never had no silver spoons and our mouths, we sold-, like do not comment on my culture, you are not qualified stab us in the back and then apologise if you knew my story you would be horrified the irony of trappin' on a boris bike got to stay alive and save my brother as well look at all these legends on the cover of elle long time comin' but we come to prevail i guess a little bit of heaven has to come with the hell, you know heavy is the head that wears the crown

i need you bad devil's in my ear i need you back got scars in my soul i have been attacked even when i am low i seem relaxed but then year's been mad i lost my way they think i went ghost to drop my tape not knowing that i fell and lost my faith like satan please no, not today so fuck this shit this are not a joke just to get away i take a toke i took this pain and made a boat lord knows how the fuck it is staying afloat last year i cried too many times were not for flipz and were not for rhymes were not for rachel, were not for kelly man them people saved my life like man'a get low sometimes, so low sometimes airplane mode on my phone sometimes sitting in my house with tears in my face can not answer the door to my bro sometimes roaming around all alone sometimes do not know sometimes i was a young ned stark but this shit's like game of thrones sometimes like bro i can not believe i saw my dad still up in the ends, still driving cabs he said "yo son, i need a car" i kissed my teeth and turned my back like "nigga, you are not seen my face for years nigga, you are not seen my face for time and the first thing you are asking me for, is that? fuck you! that is where i draw the line" should have dashed through a rack like "keep the change" and fuck letting go, i will keep the pain 23 years i am still the same when you hear this i hope you feel ashamed cah' we were broke like what the fuck mum did well to hold us up but yet she still forgave your arse but mumsy's cool, i am cold as fuck fuck that! i am still not over this fuck that! no, i am still not over this flipz told me someone died in heath like "please say i do not know the kid" when i heard ts, i kissed my teeth and then i broke down in disbelief my bro th and yogi too man i will be damned to miss the streets but i still got old school friends that i shoulda' been cool with man that i ride for, man i went school with man that i love and man i kicked ball with my phone's there, just call it but i guess things just got strange for me but you all grew fast and gracefully left my hood and grabbed the mic and i got me a girl that prays for me

song: Good Goodbye feat Pusha T and Stormzy
lyrics: so say goodbye and hit the road pack it up and disappear you better have some place to go because you can not come back around here good goodbye (do not you come back no more) live from the rhythm, it is something wild, venomous enemies trying to read me you are all looking highly illiterate blindly forgetting if i am in the mix you will not find an equivalent i have been here killing it longer than you have been alive, you idiot and it makes you so mad somebody else could be stepping in front of you and it makes you so mad that you are not the only one there is more than one of you and you can not understand the fact that it is over and done, hope you had fun you have got a lot to discuss on the bus headed back where you are from good goodbye (woo!) goodbye, good riddance a period is after every sentence did my time with my cellmate maxed out so now we finished every day was like a hail date every night was like a hailstorm took her back to my tinted windows showin' out, she in rare form wings up, now i am airborne king push, they got a chair for him make way for the new queen the old lineup, where they cheer for  them consequence when you are not there for him were you there for him? did you care for him? you were dead wrong yo let me say goodbye to my demons let me say goodbye to my past life let me say goodbye to the darkness tell  them that i would rather be here in the starlight tell  them that i would rather be here where they love me tell  them that i am yours this is our life and i still keep raising the bar like never seen a young black brother in the chart twice goodbye to the stereotypes you can not tell my kings we can not mandem we are linking tings in parks now i got to tune with linkin park like goodbye to my old hoe's goodbye to the cold roads i can not die for my postcode young little mike from the gold coast and now i am inside with my bro bro's so say goodbye and hit the road (gang)

(oh my days, oh my days) shellins i made juice, life gave me lemons you little fuckboys do my head in henry viii, behead  them, 'head  them, 'head  them can not tell where i am headin' (no) could be glasto', could be reading (yes) i was on the field like beding (beding) dead him, dead him, dead him, dead him big mike, i am handlin' my weight big mike, i am standin' with the greats one week it is "blinded by your grace" next week it is bang you in your face oh god, they love to wind me up but one by one, i line  them up oh, you think you are back? come try your luck big michael's back, your time is up alright, check this man can not tell me 'bout stretchin' fivers i was on my pushback, clips and drivers man want to diss, then text in private dem man are cool, but the rest do not like us i am not scared of lions, bears who lie on prayers, dem threats will not find us man's not scared of ticks and spiders think man's scared of sets and cyphers? i am sorry that i am late and i missed your call but you know night turn into day, i did not stop to pause i know i never see your face and baby, that is my fault but i'ma fix all my mistakes, so do not stress no more you got those cigarettes and cush you do not ever let me down you got those cigarettes and cush (alright) got those cigarettes and cush all those other girls just look they are not never takin' your crown and girl, i know it gets on your nerves sometimes when i do not answer my phone and yeah, i double back on my words at times but please do not start with that tone, because girl i love you, you know, but i can not be there but when i get home, just roll my weed, yeah what is mine is yours, give you space to breathe here just weed and cush, that is a major key here yeah, then you play me a song smokin' smoke 'til we are wavy and gone come home from a long hard day with the dons like where is my baby? i am sorry it is been long as much as you think you are alone in the way that you feel i come home every day when it rain but it is real between us, ground so far beneath us, sometimes i can not read ya but it do not mean i will not treat ya to a blunt full of that reefer we may get in fights but i could never see me leavin' something 'bout how close the high can bring us sober just do not please us if you are wondering, yeah, i am still here because i see us but mary makes it easy to talk to you aww, yeah, because sometimes i just can not spill my thoughts to you (i took you in every day) at the end of every day i belong to you (belong to you) i will still pass the bong to you i will write a song to you i will do no wrong to you i promise i will not ever let you down because you do not ever let me down i can not ever let you down, down, down down, down, down, down it is been like a month now since you left my side got me smokin' a blunt now, but there are not no vibe because i fucked up badly, all i did was push and there is no more weed, no more cush and i am deep in the south side, and i can not find love i was lookin' for my brown skin, tryna find that buzz now what have you done, stormz? now what have you caused? and we were not just brethrens, we were so much more girl, you was my hero, the beat to my heart and them tears on your face, man, they tear me apart man, i just want to fix you, fix what i broke no cuddles on the sofa, no more smoke and i pray god saves you, man i pray all night i just want to say thank you, because you saved my life but i cut you deep, and i know how it looks now there is no more weed, no more cush no more cush no more cush, yeah now there is no more cush

this is breaking news it appears that air force one was shot down somewhere over the middle east this morning by a sleeper cell of rogue terrorists, firing a stinger missile the pilot and all passengers are unaccounted for the president's whereabouts are presently unknown and he is presumed missing the vice president, secretary of state, and principals of the military are assembling our nation stands at defcon 3 the greatest crisis, will someone come for me? i "red, white and blew it" unleashed revenge, my body is detained how could anybody do this? betrayal, i peel away the days medals are useless, uncle sam's forgotten me i am not important, no one will ever come i will never be found, god get me out of this hell nuclear battlefields energized cold wars are heating up again the tensions mounting people lift up your fists in revenge the stage is set who will be the first to blink? we can not go to war remember that "vietnam thing" a peace at any price with a gun to your head, bang, bang weakness runs in your family what runs in mine is death this is your 5-minute warning burn all your classified documents and if cooler heads do not prevail first strike from a political dead man appeasement only makes the aggressor more aggressive he understands only one language, action and he respects only one word, force no sign of them stopping, no time for back channel communiques we need all the help we can get, air strikes and invasions retaliate, i say! the will of good men can not counter the terrible strain of war blackmail the universe with the greatest of calamities awaken those sleeping giants in the dust of the ground with their skin destroyed, unjust to innocence lawful possessor of the worlds last 24 hours terror and ugliness reveal what death really means and in hatred you see men as they really are if chosen over heaven, earth will have been for them all along, only another region of hell

hello me, meet the real me and my misfit's way of life a dark, black past is my most valued possession hindsight is always 20-20 but looking back, it is still a bit fuzzy speak of mutually assured destruction? nice story, tell it to reader's digest! feeling paranoid true enemy or false friend? anxiety's attacking me and my air is getting thin i am in trouble for the things i have not got to yet i am chomping at the bit and my palms are getting wet sweating bullets hello me, it is me again you can subdue, but never tame me it gives me a migraine headache sinking down to your level yeah, just keep on thinking it is my fault and stay an inch or two outta kicking distance mankind has got to know his limitations feeling claustrophobic like the walls are closing in blood stains on my hands and i do not know where i have been i am sharpening the axe i hear it in here... blood stains on my... the big axe... sweating, sweating, sweating, sweating, sweating, sweating well me, it is nice talking to myself a credit to dementia some day you too will know my pain and smile its "black-tooth grin" if the war inside my head will not take a day off i will be dead my icy fingers claw your back here i come again once you committed me now you have acquitted me claiming validity for your stupidity here i come again, whoa!

two hearts that should not talk to each other become close in a town much like a prison cell people speak our names on the street in hushed tones oh the stories they would tell if anyone would listen if anyone would listen... you come from a town where people do not bother saying "hello" unless somebody's born or dies and i come from a place where they drag your hopes through the mud because their own dreams are all dying and when we walk down the street the wind sings our names in rebel songs the sounds of the night should make us anxious but it is much too late when the fear is gone i will meet you in the next life, i promise you where we can be together, i promise you i will wait till then in heaven, i promise you i promise, i promise there is so many fighting to get past the pearly gates but nobody ever wants to die or get saved their intentions are not that good and i can smell the asphalt that is their personal road to hell being paved and it is much too late when the fear is gone i will meet you in the next life, i promise you

do i have to change my name will it get me far should i lose some weight am i going to be a star i tried to be a boy, i tried to be a girl i tried to be a mess, i tried to be the best i guess i did it wrong, that is why i wrote this song this type of modern life, is it for me this type of modern life, is it for free so, i went into a bar looking for sympathy a little company, i tried to find a friend it is more easily said it is always been the same american life i live the american dream you are the best thing i have seen you are not just a dream i tried to stay ahead, i tried to stay on top i tried to play the part, but somehow i forgot just what i did it for and why i wanted more i tried to find a friend, i tried to stay ahead i tried to stay on top fuck it i am drinking a soy latte i get a double shot it goes right through my body and you know i am satisfied i drive my mini cooper and i am feeling super-dooper yo they tell i am a trooper i do yoga and pilates and the room is full of hotties so i am checking out the bodies i am digging on the isotopes this metaphysic's shit is dope and if all this can give me hope you know i am satisfied i got a lawyer and a manager an agent and a chef three nannies, an assistant and a driver and a jet a trainer and a butler and a bodyguard or five a gardener and a stylist do you think i am satisfied i would like to express my extreme point of view i am not christian and i am not a jew i am just living out the american dream and i just realized that nothing is what it seems

who is that girl? when you see her, say a prayer and kiss your heart goodbye she is trouble, in a word get closer to the fire run faster, her laughter burns you up inside you are spinning round and round you can not get up, you try but you can not quién es esa niña? señorita, más fina you try to avoid her, fate is in your hands she is smiling, an invitation to the dance her heart is on the street, tu corazón es suyo now you are falling at her feet you try to get away but you can not light up my life, so blind i can not see light up my life, no one can help me now who is that girl now, who is that girl? who is that girl.

and love is not the easy thing the only baggage that you can bring love is not the easy thing the only baggage you can bring is all that you can not leave behind and if the darkness is to keep us apart and if the daylight feels like it is a long way off and if your glass heart should crack and for a second you turn back oh no, be strong oh, oh, walk on, walk on what you got they can not steal it no, they can not even feel it walk on, walk on stay safe tonight you are packing a suitcase for a place none of us has been a place that has to be believed to be seen you could have flown away a singing bird in an open cage who will only fly, only fly for freedom what you have got they can not deny it can not sell it, or buy it and, and i know it aches and your heart it breaks and you can only take so much walk on home, hard to know what it is if you have never had one home, i can not say where it is but i know i am going home that is where the hurt is and i know it aches leave it behind you have got to leave it behind all that you fashion all that you make all that you build all that you break all that you measure all that you feel all this you can not, leave behind all that you reason all that you care (it is only time) and i will never fill up all my mind all that you sense all that you speak all you dress up and all that you scheme all you create all that you wreck all that you hate
