song: Can It Be All So Simple Intermission
lyrics: hey you know everybody's talking about the "good old days" everybody! the good old days well, let us talk about the good old days know what i am saying? take you on this lyrical high real quick 1993 exoticness, know what i am saying? let us get technical; where is your bone at? get up on that shit, aight? yo! started off on the island, aka shaolin niggas wilin', gun shots thrown, the phone dialin back in the days of 8 now, making a tape now rae got to get a plate now ignorant and mad young, wanted to be the one till i got (blaow! blaow! blaow!) felt one yeah, my pops was a fiend since 16 shooting that "that is that shit!" in his blood stream that is the life of a grimey, real-life crimey and niggas know that habit's behind me day one, yo, growing all up in the ghetto now i am a weed fiend, jetting the palmetto in medina, yo, no doubt the god got crazy clout pushing the big joint from down south so if you are filthy stacked up better watch your back and duck because these fiends, they got it cracked up now my man from up north, now he got the law it is solid as a rock and crazy salt no jokes, i am not playing, get his folks desert eagle his dick and put em in a yoke and to know for sure, i got reck and rip shop i pointed a gat at his mother's knot (yo, rae, do not do that shit, man! do not do that shit!) fuck that! dedicated to the winners and the losers dedicated to all jeeps and land cruisers (can it be that it was all so simple then?) dedicated to the y's, 850-i's dedicated to niggas who do drive-bys dedicated to the lexus and the ac's dedicated to mpv's: phat! kicking the fly cliches doing duets with rae and a, happens to make my day though i am tired of busting off shots, having to rock knots running up in spots and making shit hot i would rather flip shows instead of those hanging on my living room wall: my first joint - and it went gold! i want to lamp, i want to be in the shade plus the spotlight, getting my dick rode all night i want to have me a phat yacht and enough land to go and plant my own sess crops but for now it is just a big dream because i find myself in the place where i am last seen my thoughts must be relaxed, be able to maintain because times is changed and life is strange the glorious days is gone, and everybody's doing bad yo, mad lives is up for grabs brothers passing away, i got to make wakes receiving all types of calls from upstate yo, i can not cope with the pressure settling for lesser the god left lessons on my dresser so i can bloom and blossom, find a new way to continue to make more hits with rae and a sunshine plays a major part in the daytime peace to mankind, ghostface carry a black 9

song: You Gotta Fight For Your Right To Party
lyrics: kick it you wake up late for school, man, you do not want to go you ask your mom, please? but she still says, no you missed two classes and no homework but your teacher preaches class like you are some kind of jerk and you got to fight fight your right to party your pops caught you smoking and he said, no way that hypocrite smokes two packs a day man, living at home is such a drag now your mom threw away your best porno mag busted do not step out of this house if that is the clothes you are going to wear i will kick you out of my home if you do not cut that hair your mom busted in and said, what is that noise? mom you are just jealous it is the beastie boys you got to fight party

let it flow - let yourself go slow and low - that is the tempo it is never old school - all brand new so everybody catch - the bugaloo flu not like a fever - not like a cold the beats are clear - the rhymes are bold so do not see a doctor or see a nurse just listen to the music - first things first first of all - get off the wall it is time to party so have a ball because we slowed it on down - so get the hell up like a volcano i will erupt we got determination - bass and highs white castle fries only come in one size what you see is what you get and you are not seen - nothing yet i do not sing - but i make a def song you could live your whole life - and i hope you live long on the gong show we will not get gonged we are the beastie boys - not cheech and chong strong as an ox - fresh out the box the crowd is so live - they are coming in flocks and when we go on - the crowd goes off it is all hard rock - there is nothing soft we do not only rock the house but we will house we rock we do not stroll but we roll straight to the top m.c.a., adrock, mike d. makes three and we can do it like this in the place to be when i am recorded - you will be rewarded i know my song is def because you all applauded not p.c.p. or l.s.d. - just me mike d. in the place to be this is not free - you must pay a fee cash on delivery like a c.o.d. the beat is slow in order to dance i want to hear i dos and no i can not first you move your legs - and then your arms it is not fast and nervous - this dance is calm it is truly stable and you ought to be able to dance to the record when it is on the turntable

kick it! you wake up late for school, man, you do not want to go you ask your mom, "please?", but she still says, "no!" you missed two classes and no homework but your teacher preaches class like you are some kind of jerk you got to fight for your right to party your pop caught you smoking, and he said, "no way!" that hypocrite smokes two packs a day man, living at home is such a drag now your mom threw away your best porno "mag" (busted) do not step out of this house if that is the clothes you are going to wear i will kick you out of my home if you do not cut that hair your mom busted in and said, "what is that noise?" aw, mom you are just jealous, it is the beastie boys party

now i rock a house party at the drop of a hat, yeah and i beat a body down with an aluminum bat a lot of people they be jonesin' just to hear me rock the mic they will be staring at the radio staying up all night so like a pimp, i am pimpin' i got a boat to eat shrimp in nothing wrong with my leg just b-boy limpin' got arrested at the mardi gras for jumping on a float my man mca's got a beard like a billy goat oowah oowah is my disco call mca, hu-huh, i am gettin' rope you all routines i bust and the rhymes that i write and i will be busting routines and rhymes all night like eating burgers and chicken and you will be picking your nose man, i am on time, homie, that is how it goes you heard my style i think you missed the point it is the joint mike d, yeah? with your bad self runnin' things what is up with your bad breath onion rings well, i am mike d and i am back from the dead chillin' at the beach down at club med make another record because the people they want more of this suckers they be saying they can take out adam horovitz hurricane you got clout other djs he will put your head out a puppet on a string i am paid to sing or rhyme or do my thing i am in a lava lamp inside my brain hotel i might be peakin' or freakin' but i rock well the patty duke show, the wrench and then i bust the tango got more rhymes than jamaicans got mangoes i got the peg leg at the end of my stump shake your rump full clout you all, full clout you all and when the mic is in my mouth i turn it out you all full clout never been dumped because i am the most mackinest never been jumped because i am known the most packinest yeah we have got beef chief, we are knocking out teeth chief and if you do not believe us you should question your belief keith i am like sam the butcher bringing alice the meat like fred flintstone driving around with bald feet should i have another sip? no skip it in the back of the ride and bust with the whippet rope a dope dookies all around the neck woo-ha, got them all in check running from the law, the press, and the parents is your name michael diamond? no mine's clarence from downtown, manhattan, the village my style is wild and you know that it still is disco bag schlepping and you are doing the bump

well this girl came up to me, she says she is new in town but the crew been said they seen her around i thought they were right but i did not want to know the girlie was def and she wanted to go i think her name is lucy but they all call loose i think i thought i seen her on eighth and forty-deuce the next thing she said, "my place or yours? let us kick some bass behind closed doors!" we got into the cab, the cab driver said he recognized my girlie from the back of her head he said a little something about tip to base so i made him stop the cab to get out of the place i should not have looked back man i will always regret it something's going on and i will probably never get it she was crying like a baby, stupid dumb it is just too bad that girl's a bum she is crafty, she is gets around she is crafty she is always down she is crafty, she is got a gripe she is crafty and she is just my type she is crafty i spent my last dollar to by a sabrett when i seen this girl i could never forget now i like nothing better than a pretty girl smile and i have not seen a smile that pretty in a while the girl came up to me she said she loved the show asked her to come home and she could not say, "no!" we got the crib, there is adam and d. we did not say a word, they just stared at me i said, "i do not know her just met her tonight." and adrock started hiding everything in sight d. pulled me over said, "hide your gold, the girl is crafty like ice is cold!" the girl is crafty, she knows all the moves i started playing records, she knew all the grooves he thought she was a thief and d. was right but i just figured she would spend the night when i woke up late in the afternoon she had taken all the things from inside his room i found myself sleeping in the middle of the floor she had taken the bed and the chest of drawers the mirror, the tv, the new guitar cord my remote control and my old skateboard she robbed us blind, she took all we owned and the boys blamed me for bringing her home

i can not stand it, i know you planned it i am-a set it straight, this watergate i can not stand rockin' when i am in here because your crystal ball are not so crystal clear so while you sit back and wonder why i got this fuckin' thorn in my side oh my god, it is a mirage i am tellin' you all, it is a sabotage so, so, so, so listen up, because you can not say nothing you will shut me down with a push of your button but yo, i am out and i am gone i will tell you now, i keep it on and on because what you see, you might not get and we can bet, so do not you get souped yet scheming on a thing, that is a mirage i am trying to tell you now, it is sabotage why (our backs are now against the wall) listen all of you all it is a sabotage but i can not stand rockin' when i am in this place because i feel disgrace because you are all in my face but make no mistakes and switch up my channel i am buddy rich when i fly off the handle what could it be, it is a mirage you are scheming on a thing, that is sabotage

oah-kayyyyy! you talk and talk and you just can not stop but when it comes to mine - it is crock what you say, is lackluster i thrash emcees who try to bring a filibuster yeah, right, get off me tell me somethin new to start with thee said see you later, when you comin home? it is a gift, it is a curse, it is a telephone now let us start over with a nice clean slate please stop stressin with the hurry up wait heard you the first time, that sounds great but back up out my space, okay? (yeah yeah, right right) okay! okay! got the pink ribbon, so pretty my name's mike d from new york city i guess it is all, in the mind what, i, leave, behind go to these schools like a nice mad professor then i show chagrin every word that you utter yes you said you are a big deal but money calm down - for real! got, to control my mind get to slow down, rewind what, is goin on in my head? was this guy on med? (what is goin on in my head? was that guy on meds?) (what is goin on in my head? what is goin on in my head? was that guy on meds? (what is goin on in my head?) now, i do not give a fuck who the hell you are please stop shoutin in your cellular i never asked you for part of your day so please stop shoutin in your phone, okay you loud like a cop take a look and take a look and then stop took a minute get your mind unlocked get the rhythm when i do the wop what is goin on in in my head? and why has this guy gone all red? be kind, rewind at least tell me what it is i did or just say what should i say hmmm... okay! (yeah yeah, right, right) okay!

no sleep 'til, brooklyn foot on the pedal, never ever false metal engine running hotter than a boiling kettle my job's are not a job, it is a damn good time city to city, i am running my rhymes on location touring around the nation beastie boys always on vacation itchy trigger finger but a stable turntable i do what i do best because i am illing and able are not no faking your money i am taking going coast to coast watching all the gir lies shaking while you are at the job working nine to five the beastie boys at the garden, cold kickin' it live no sleep 'til another place, another train another bottle in the brain another girl, another fight another drive all night our manager's crazy, he always smokes dust he is got his own room at the back of the bus tour around the world, you rock around the clock plane to hotel, girls on the jock we are thrashing hotels like it is going out of style getting paid along the way because it is worth your while four on the floor, adrock's out the door m.c.a.'s in the back because he is skeezin' with a whor- we got a safe in the trunk with money in a stack with dice in the front and brooklyn's in the back no sleep 'til brooklyn are not seen the light since we started this band m.c.a. get on the mic my man born and bred brooklyn you.s.a. they all me adam yauch, but i am m.c.a. like a lemon to a lime, a lime to a lemon i sip the def ale with all the fly women got limos, arena, tv shows autograph pictures and classy hos step off homes, get out of my way taxing little girlies form here to l.a waking up before i get to sleep because i will be rocking this party eight days a week no, (no), sleep, (sleep), 'til brooklyn ('til brooklyn) no, (no), sleep, (sleep), 'til brooklyn no, (no), sleep, (sleep), 'til brooklyn, (brooklyn) no, (no), slepp, (sleep), 'til brooklyn, (brooklyn)

yes, here we go again, give you more, nothing lesser back on the mic is the anti-depressor ad-rock, no pressure, yes, we need this the best is yet to come, and yes, believe this leggo my eggo while i flex my ego step off my seco, dressed up tuxedo sipping coffee, playing keno in the casino want a lucky number, ask mike dino i burn the competition like a flamethrower my rhymes age like wine as i get older i am getting bolder, competition is waning i got the feeling and assume the lane and we got a party on the left, a party on the right we going to party for the motherf-cking right to fight make some noise if you are with me armed insurrection, popular election get paid every year like tax collection hear my perfection, rotary connection taking mcs down by lethal rap injection i am like an ornithologist when i get pissed you must have drank a fizzy-lifting drink and you got lifted and sifted, i am just whiffed and when i catch mcs it is time for wing-clipping i fly like a hawk, or better yet an eagle a seagull, i sniff suckers out like a beagle my ego is off and running and gone because i am about the best and if you diss than that is wrong pass me the scalpel, i will make an incision i will cut off the part of your brain that does the bitching put it in formaldehyde and put it in the shelf and you can show it to your friends and say "that is my old self" can not do me nothing, can not tell me nada do not quote me now because i am doing the lambada the forbidden dance, here's my chance to make romance in my b-boy stance parlay romancing into the financing opened up a restaurant with ted danson the roaches check in, but they never check out i set the record straight, no doubt

now here's a little story i gots to tell about three bad brothers you know so well it started way back in history with adrock, mca and me, mike d been had a little horsey named paul revere just me and my horsey and a quart of beer ridin' 'cross the land, kickin' up sand sheriff's posses on my tail because i am in demand one lonely beastie i be all by myself without nobody the sun is beatin' down on my baseball hat the air is gettin' hot, the beer is gettin' flat lookin' for a girl, i ran into a guy his name is mca, i said "how do you", he said "hi" he told a little story that sounded well rehearsed four days on the run and that he is dying of thirst the brew was in my hand, and he was on my tip his voice was hoarse, his throat was dry, he asked me for a sip he said "can i get some?" i said "you can not get none" i had a chance to run pulled out his shotgun quick on the draw, i thought i would be dead he put the gun to my head and this is what he said "now my name is mca, i got a license to kill i think you know what time it is, it is time to get i will so what do we have here? an outlaw and his beer i run this land, you understand, i have made myself clear" we stepped into the wind, he had a gun, i had a grin you think this story's over, but it is ready to begin "now i have got the gun, you have got the brew you have got two choices of what you can do it is not a tough decision as you can see i can blow you away or you can ride with me" i said, "i will ride with you if you can get me to the border the sheriff's after me for what i did to his daughter i did it like this, i did it like that i did it with the whiffle ball bat so i am on the run, the cop's got my gun and right about now it is time to have some fun the king adrock, that is my name and i know the fly spot where they got the champagne" we rode for six hours then we hit the spot the beat was-a-bumpin' and the girlies was hot this dude was starin' like he knows who we are we took the empty spot next to him at the bar mca said "yippe-yo, you know this kid?" i said i did not but i know he did the kid said, "get ready, because this are not funny my name is mike d and i am 'bout to get money" pulled out the jammey, aimed it at the sky he yelled, "stick  them up!" and let two fly hands went up and people hit the floor he wasted two kids that ran for the door "i am mike d and i get respect your cash and your jewelry is what i expect" mca was with it, and he is my ace so i grabbed the piano player and punched him in the face the piano player's out, the music stopped his boy had beef, and he got dropped mike d grabbed the money, mca snatched the gold i grabbed two girlies and a beer that is cold

intergalactic, planetary, planetary, intergalactic another dimension, another dimension another dimension well, now, do not you tell me to smile you stick around i will make it worth your while my number's beyond what you can dial maybe it is because we are so versatile style, profile, i said it always brings me back when i hear, "ooh, child!" from the hudson river out to the nile i run the marathon to the very last mile well, if you battle me i feel reviled people always sayin' my style is wild you have got gall, you have got guile step to me i am a rap-o-phile if you want to battle you are in denial comin' from uranus to check my style go ahead, put my rhymes on trial cast you off into exile jazz and a.w.o.l, that is our team step inside the party, disrupt the whole scene when it comes to beats, well, i am a fiend i like my sugar with coffee and cream well, i got to keep it going keep it going full steam too sweet to be sour too nice to be mean well, on the tough-guy style i am not too keen trying to change the world, i am going to plot and scheme mario c. likes to keep it clean going to shine like a sunbeam keep on rappin', because that is my dream thank moe dee for 'sticking to themes' now when it comes to envy you all is green jealous of the rhyme and the rhyme routine another dimension, new galaxy intergalactic, planetary we are from the family tree of old school hip-hop kick off your shoes and relax your socks the rhymes are spread just like a pox because the music is loud like an electric shock i am known to do the wop also known for the flintstone flop tammy d gets biz on the crops beastie boys known to let the beat mmm, drop! now when i wrote graffiti my name was slop if my rap's soup, my beats is stock step from the table when i start to chop i am a lumberjack dj adrock if you try to knock me you will get mocked i will stir fry you in my wok your knees'll start shakin' and your fingers pop like a pinch on the neck of mr. spock

song: It Ain t Hard to Tell
lyrics: da da da da da da da da da da (yeah!) it are not hard to tell, i excel then prevail the mic is contacted, i attract clientele my mic check is life or death, breathing a sniper's breath i exhale the yellow smoke of buddha through righteous steps deep like the shining, sparkle like a diamond sneak a uzi on the island in my army jacket lining hit the earth like a comet â€“ invasion! nas is like the afrocentric asian, half-man, half-amazing because in my physical, i can express through song delete stress like motrin, then extend strong i drink moet with medusa, give her shotguns in hell from the spliff that i lift and inhale, it are not hard to tell the buddha monk's in your trunk, turn the bass up not stories by aesop, place your loot up, parties i shoot up nas, i analyze, drop a jewel, inhale from the l school a fool well, you feel it like braille, it are not hard to tell i kick a skill like shaquille holds a pillannotate vocabulary spills i am i will plus matic i freak beats, slam it like iron sheik jam like a tec with correct techniques so analyze me, surprise me, but can not magnetize me scannin' while you are plannin' ways to sabotage me i leave  them froze like her-on in your nose nas'll rock well, it are not hard to tell this rhythmatic explosion is what your frame of mind has chosen i will leave your brain stimulated, niggas is frozen speak with criminal slang, begin like a violin end like leviathan, it is deep, well let me try again wisdom be leaking out my grapefruit, troop i dominate break loops, giving mics men-e-strual cycles street's disciple, i rock beats that is mega trifle and groove even smoother than moves by villanova you are still a soldier, i am like sly stone in cobra packing like a rasta in the weed spot, vocals'll squeeze glocks mc's eavesdrop though they need not to sneak my poetry's deep, i never fail nas' raps should be locked in a cell, it are not hard to tell

(ninety-four real shit you all, harry o!) fuck you all crab ass niggaz though (yeah, bitch ass niggas!) (bitch ass niggas) bitch ass motherfucker i am from queen's bridge motherfucker

freedom or jail, clips inserted, a baby's bein' born same time my man is murdered, the beginning and end as far as rap go, it is only natural, i explain my plateau and also, what defines my name first it was nasty but times have changed ask me now, i am the artist but hardcore, my science for pain i spent time in the game, kept my mind on fame saw fiends shoot up and do lines of cocaine saw my close friends shot, flatline am i sane? much to success to ya, even if you wish me the opposite sooner or later we will all see who the prophet is nas is like sex to a nympho but nothing sweet i am like beef, bustin' heat through your windows i am like a street sweeper, green leaf griever like greeks in egypt, learnin' something deep from they teachers i am like crime, like your nine, your man you would die for always got you, i am like pac, dude you would cry for i am like a whole lot of loot, i am like crisp money corporate accounts from a rich company i am like ecstasy for ladies, i am like all races combined in one man; like the '99 summer jam bulletproof hummer man i am like being locked down around new faces and none of  them fam' i am the feelin' of a millionaire spendin' a hundred grand i am a poor man's dream, a thug poet live it and i write down and i watch it blow up you all know what i am like, you all play it your system every night now nas is like

state of mind nasty nas nasty nas...

the cops used to come around in my neighborhood alright, you kids, stop having so much fun, move along! oh they would arrest me, you know, especially at night they had a curfew, niggas had to be home at 11, negros, 12 and you would be trying to get home, doing your crew runs and they would always catch you out in front of a store or something because you would be taking shortcuts, right cops, "ree, put your hands up, black boy!" the cops shot the kid the cops shot the kid, the cops shot i do not want to hurt nobody we just came here to party see a few dames, exchange some names i am a top shotta, kid, stay in your lane the cop shot the kid, same old scene pour out a little liquor, champagne for pain slap-boxin' in the street crack the hydrant in the heat cop cars on the creep doing they round-ups, we just watch for the sweep yeah, it is hotter than july it is the summer when niggas die it is the summer when niggas ride together we will be strong, but forever we divide so you all are blowin' my high type of shit that is killin' my vibe white kids are brought in alive black kids get hit with like five get scared, you panic, you are going down the disadvantages of the brown how in the hell the parents gon' bury their own kids not the other way around? it is certain things i can not abide by i are not bein' extreme, this is my side talkin' big shit, ready to die i know every story got two sides claimin' he paranoid by the black guy cop want to make it home by nighttime just a good kid, he was not that guy had a little hit, he was not that high cop gon' claim that it was self-defense say he was ridin' dirty so the case rests (workin' nine-to-five) (tryna stay alive) (makin' ends meet) (shot him this week)

song: If I Ruled the World Imagine That
lyrics: life... i wonder... will it take me under... i do not know imagine smoking weed in the streets without cops harassin' imagine going to court with no trial lifestyle cruising blue behind my waters no welfare supporters more conscious of the way we raise our daughters days are shorter, nights are colder feeling like life is over, these snakes strike like a cobra the world's hot my son got not evidently it is elementary, they want us all gone eventually trooping out of state for a plate knowledge of coke was cooked without the garbage we would all have the top dollars imagine everybody flashin', fashion designer clothes, lacing your click up with diamond vogues your people holdin' dough, no parole no rubbers, go in raw imagine law with no undercovers just some thoughts for the mind i take a glimpse into time watch the blimp read, the world is mine if i ruled the world (imagine that) i would free all my sons (i love  them, love  them baby) black diamonds and pearls could it be, if you could be mine we would both shine if i ruled the world still livin' for today, in these last days and times the way to be, paradise like relaxin' black, latino and anglo-saxon armani exchange the reins cash, lost tribe of shabazz, free at last brand new whips to crash then we laugh in the iller path the villa house is for the crew, how we do trees for breakfast, dime sexes and benz stretches so many years of depression make me vision the better livin', type of place to raise kids in open they eyes to the lies history's told foul but i am as wise as the old owl, plus the gold child seeing things like i was controlling, click rollin' trickin six digits on kicks and still holdin' trips to paris, i civilized every savage give me one shot i turn trife life to lavish political prisonner set free, stress free no work release purple m3's and jet skis feel the wind breeze in west indies i make coretta scott-king mayor the cities and reverse themes to willies it sounds foul but every girl i meet to go downtown i would open every cell in attica send  them to africa could it be, if you could be mine, we would both shine and then we will walk right up to the sun hand in hand we will walk right up to the sun we will not land you would love to hear the story how the thugs live in worry duck down in car seats, heat's mandatory runnin' from jake, gettin' chased, hunger for papes these are the breaks many mistakes go down out of state wait, i had to let it marinate we carry weight tryin' to get laced, flip the ace stack the safe millionaire plan to keep the gat with the cop camera makin' moves in atlanta, back and forth scrambler because you could have all the chips, be poor or rich still nobody want a nigga having shit if i ruled the world and everything in it, sky's the limit i push a q-45 infinit it would not be no such thing as jealousies or b felonies strictly living longevity to the destiny i thought i would never see but reality struck better find out before your time's out, what the fuck? if i ruled the world (if i ruled, if i ruled) i would free all my sons (i love  them, love  them baby) black diamonds and pearls (if i ruled) i love  them, love  them baby

happy birthday you are not got to question it you already know the answer the truth do not make us relevant hurts but it is necessary do not want us to lose what we are lose what we are if it are not broke then we do not need to fix it believing in that she say i have you livid no, they will not be happy 'til your love is over they tryna break us up but you do not want to get it they are not never had your back like i got it they are not never had trust like how we got it so they can not help but to come and hate on it they see what we got and you know they want it do not question it it is like you are always looking for a problem but there are not enough equations for you to solve  them so quick to turn nothing right into something get the numbers out my phone, go 'head and call  them they are not never had my back like you got it they are not never had a chance how you got it she texts me "how is your love life? " and "how are you? ", i said "i am good." they only get as close as you allow them to we should be closer together, warm oceans, better weather instead of us playing games forever, she says whatever i says whatever, who get you wetter than a half-moon wearer hstry sweater, serendipity when you with me swear you love that one thing we did that one time in that one place blew your mind, you got my mind gone when i am home i am serious girl, a much older dude, a whole 42 i have accomplished my goals, it is only you you and i in that wraith, retired my pimp super-fly cape just my mets cap and my batch and i am straight esco do not want to lose, no do not want to still lose what we are we can not lose

can not buy this, superflyness, like a shyness, your highness it is performin', look how long the line is that is what happens when you make shit that is timeless that is what happens these rappers is the pioneers what do it take to be a legend like nas is? that is so novice, i am so polished, i got a right to be a little bit snobbish i did a little bit of college, semesters it took 2 like rob base to let me figure out this was not my place, the beat slowed til' you listened to my pace cuz i be killin' shit, but that is evident, and you all feelin' it, but i expected it if it is classic it is going to last forever than i am everywhere you never been and better than i ever been perseverance, see the fake hustler rapper to them it hurts to hear this o you went platinum – yeah that is nice, now let me see you do the same thing twice new times, 4 times, then been a couple of more times, please your amateur night is show time it is one life to live so live it the best you can, the world could use one less man not enough air, not enough car factories to manufacture new vehicles sedans and vans when they do make the whip you like ya chips are not right, by the time you could afford it the car are not important in the streets silent, it is just i and - cops keep firin' in my environment leavin' your slum when they drive home far from the hood brothers they eager to jump on i like to be the wall that they post up on, i like to see them fall, guilty for doing wrong i am classic like the air ones, the hustler shoe, that is what i am accustomed to how many you all got criminal minded you you you you all do not be blinded me i got no jewels on my neck, why – i do not need  them i got your respect krs 1 20 years i rock i do it for jmj and scott larock – this hip hop and we's a nation, do not you want to hear more krs on your radio station? instead of broadcasting how we smokin' trees, on the radio we need to hear more local mc's where you at? come on where you at? this is the difference between mc'ing and rap rappers spit rhymes that are mostly illegal, mc's spit rhymes to uplift they people peace, love, unity, and having fun, these are the lyrics of krs one is you all ready for twenty-0-7, it is now another drought everyone's a killer, wow we buggin out since 86 showin the crowd what i am about and they still want to know when the album comin' out ask the teenagers, o'gs and ask the kids what they definition of classic is timeless, because age do not count in the booth and your flow stays submerged in the fountain of youth and no doubt the truth i am off the meters everybody co-signing even non-believers i came in the door, became one of y'alls leaders in the fresh pair of air force one sneakers uptown we call  them uppies when they on divas prolly worn when krs one teaches nas, made you look, before the haters i bet you kan had  them on when he walked with jesus this is classic

it is yours! whose world is this? the world is yours, the world is yours it is mine, it is mine, it is mine whose world is this? "it is yours!" i sip the dom p, watchin gandhi til i am charged then writin in my book of rhymes, all the words pass the margin to hold the mic i am throbbin, mechanical movement understandable smooth shit that murderers move wit the thief's theme, play me at night, they will not act right the fiend of hip-hop has got me stuck like a crack pipe the mind activation, react like i am facin time like slaughter thinkin a word best describin my life, to name my daughter my strength, my son, the star, will be my resurrection born in correction all the wrong shit i did, he will lead a right direction how ya livin large, a broker charge, cards are mediocre you flippin coke or playin spit spades in strip poker yo, the world is yours, the world is yours break it down i am the young city bandit, hold myself down singlehanded for murder raps, i kick my thoughts alone, get remanded born alone, die alone, no crew to keep my crown or throne i am deep by sound alone, caved inside in a thousand miles from home i need a new nigga, for this black cloud to follow because while it is over me it is too dark to see tomorrow trying to maintain, i flip, fill the clip to the tip picturin my peeps, now the income make my heartbeat skip and i am amped up, they locked the champ up, even my brain's in handcuffs headed for indiana stabbin women like the phantom the crew is lampin big willie style check the chip toothed smile, plus i profile wild stash through the flock wools, burnin dollars to light my stove walk the blocks wit a bop, checkin danes plus the games people play, bust the problems of the world today yeah... the world is yours, the world is yours yea aight? to everybody in queens, the foundation "it is yours!" the world is yours to everybody uptown, yo, the world is yours "it is yours!" to everybody in brooklyn you all know the world is yours "it is yours!" everbody in mount vernon, the world is yours "it is yours!" long island, the world is yours "it is yours!" staten island, yea the world is yours "it is yours!" south bronx, the world is yours "it is yours!" aight it is yours!...

check me out you all nasty nas in your area about to because mass hysteria before i blunt, i take out my fronts then i start to front; matter of fact, i be on a manhunt you could not catch me in the streets without a ton of reefer that is like malcolm x catching the jungle fever king poetic. too much flavor, i am major atlanta are not brave-r, i will pull a number like a pager because i am an ace when i face the bass 40-side is the place that is giving me grace now wait, another dose and you might be dead and i am a nike-head, i wear chains that excite the feds and are not a damn thing going to change i'mma performer strange, so the mic warmer was born to gain nas, why did you do it you know you got the mad fat fluid when you rhyme, it is halftime it is halftime this is how it feel, check it out, how it feel it is like that, you know it is like that i got it hemmed, now you never get the mic back when i attack, there are not an army that could strike back so i react never calmly on a hype track i set it off with my own rhyme because i am as i will as a convict who kills for phone time i am max like cassettes, i flex like sex in your stereo sets, nas'll catch wreck i used to hustle - now all i do is relax and strive when i was young i was a fan of the jackson 5 i drop jewels, wear jewels, hope to never run it with more kicks than a baby in a mother's stomach nasty nas has to rise because i am wise this is exercise 'til the microphone dies back in '83 i was an mc sparkin' but i was too scared to grab the mics in the parks and kick my little raps because i thought nigga would not understand and now in every jam i am the fuckin' man i rap in front of more niggas than in the slave ships i used to watch "chips", now i load glock clips i got to have it, i miss mr. magic versatile, my style switches like a faggot but not bisexual, i am an intellectual of rap i am a professional and that is no question, yo these are the lyrics of the man, you can not near it, understand? because in the streets, i am well-known like the number man am i in place with the bass and format explore rap and tell me "nas are not all that" and next time i rhyme, i be foul whenever i freestyle i see trial, niggas say i am wild i hate a rhyme-biter's rhyme stay tuned, nas soon - the real rap comes at halftime i got it going on, even flip a morning song every afternoon, i kick half the tune and in the darkness, i am heartless like when the narc's hit word to marcus garvey: i hardly sparked it because when i blast the herb, that is my word i be slayin' them fast, doing this that and the third but chill, pass the andre, and let us slay i bag bitches up at john jay, and hit a matinee putting hits on 5-0 because when it is my time to go, i wait for god with the .44 and biters can not come near and yo: "go to hell" to the foul cop who shot garcia i will not plant seeds, do not need an extra mouth i can not feed that is extra phillie change, more cash for damp weed this goes out to manhattan, the island of staten brooklyn and queens is living fat and the boogie down, enough props, enough clout i will will, rest in peace, yo, i am out

you will live and you will learn see because you have never been the same as anyone else do not think the same as everyone else see you will never conclude with anyone else if i had everything, everything i could change anything if i changed anything, i mean anything i would change everything, oh yeah dark boy, do not you cry there is too much life left in those eyes do not you let that face go waterfall do not you learn to love your scars and all dark boy, do not you die, they are just human, let them lie you just know your world and speak your truth let them come to you, for your love and your heart this is your court, there are no laws i could change anything, i could change anything when the media slings mud, we use it to build huts irrefutable facts, merciful, beautiful black beloved brother, you fail to embarrass him, harassin' him to my life, your life pales in comparison so go write whatever blog, messiness is not ever the god do what is necessary, i am never worried listen vultures, i have been shackled by western culture you convinced most of my people to live off emotion that is why we competin' death by the chrome barrel, forgot the secrets my kilimanjaro bone marrow's the deepest you can peep at the comments, but do not fall for that we want freedom, i am a scholar, an almanac people do anything to be involved in everything inclusion is a hell of a drug some people have everything they probably ever wanted in life and never have enough from the birth of a child, the world is foul excursions of a searchin' child should learn to take nothing personal a parent hates to watch his baby's face takin' his first immunization shots, but this is great the child's introduction to suffering and pain understands without words, nothing is explained or rushed to the brain, lookin' up at his parents' face like, "i thought you would protect me from this scary place?" "why'd you let them inject me?" "who is going to know how these side effects is going to affect me?" who knew i would grow to meet presidents that respect me? if starbucks is bought by nestlã©, please do not arrest me i need to use your restroom and i are not buy no espresso soon enough assume the cuffs, the position, not new to us since back on the bus sittin', said, "screw that bus!" boycotted that bus outta business the future's us, yet every citizen's in prison watch me as i walk through the folly, golly, new york to saudi in italy, i am eduardo wiccari but nasty the hustler, nasty like mustard gas, sulfur and i could sell alaska to russia, no pressure my first house, 11,000-square-feet mansion it was a haunted by dead rich whites mad a nigga bought his crib to hang up pictures of black christ circular driveways, black cars and black ice my second house, still in my twenties, illin' with money chilled through my spine, spillin' wine, it is funny did good for a staircase loiterer, euphoria what you saw when you seen a teen turn to a warrior did every fourth of july, bustin' in the sky it was important to a guy who was mob-minded future murcielago driver 'til lambos got average on me i started likin' the look like i are not had no money yellow taxi seats over maybach seats, just to remind me just to inspire me, to stay focused, it is a real sick society just because i got your support do not mean you are buyin' me i am buyin' back the land owned by the slave masters where my ancestors lived, just to say a rapper made a change, the pants-sagger put plans in action 'til they claim the pan-african made it happen see because you have never been the same anyone else dark boy, do not you cry, there is too much life left in those eyes and let them come to you for your love and your heart

song: Where Did It All Go Wrong
lyrics: two, three, four ... you know that feeling you get you feel you are older than time you are not exactly sure if you have been away a while do you keep the receipts for the friends that you buy? and are not it bittersweet you are only just getting by but i hope you know that it will not let go it sticks around with you until the day you die and i hope you know that it is touch and go i hope the tears do not stain the world that waits outside where did it all go wrong? and until you have repaid the dreams you bought for your lies you will be cast away alone under stormy skies, alone under stormy skies

i need to be myself i can not be no one else i am feeling supersonic give me gin and tonic you can have it all but how much do you want it? you make me laugh give me your autograph can i ride with you in your bmw? you can sail with me in my yellow submarine you need to find out no one's going to tell you what i am on about you need to find a way for what you want to say but before tomorrow because my friend said he would take you home he sits in a corner all alone he lives under a waterfall nobody can see him nobody can ever hear him call you need to be yourself you can not be no one else i know a girl called elsa she is into alka seltzer she sniffs it through a cane on a supersonic train and she makes me laugh i got her autograph she done it with a doctor on a helicopter she is sniffin in her tissue sellin' the big issue when she finds out no one's going to tell her what i am on about so you need to find a way for what she wants to say

lyrics: going back to the corner where i first saw you going to camp in my sleeping bag i am not going to move got some words on cardboard, got your picture in my hand saying if you see this girl can you tell her where i am some try to hand me money, they do not understand i am not broke i am just a broken hearted man i know it makes no sense but what else can i do how can i move on when i am still in love with you because if one day you wake up and find that you are missing me and your heart starts to wonder where on this earth i could be thinkin' maybe you will come back here to the place that we would meet you will see me waiting for you on our corner of the street so i am not moving, i am not moving policeman says, son you can not stay here i said, there is someone i am waiting for if it is a day, a month, a year got to stand my ground even if it rains or snows if she changes her mind this is the first place she will go thinking maybe you will come back here to the place that we would meet i am not moving, i am not moving people talk about the guy who is waiting on a girl there are no holes in his shoes but a big hole in his world maybe i will get famous as the man who can not be moved maybe you will not mean to but you will see me on the news and you will come running to the corner because you will know it is just for you you will know it is just for you so i am not moving, i am not moving, no so i am going back to the corner where i first saw you

i am still alive but i am barely breathing just prayed to a god that i do not believe in because i got time while she got freedom because when a heart breaks, no, it do not breakeven her best days will be some of my worst she finally met a man that is going to put her first while i am wide awake she is no trouble sleeping because when a heart breaks no it do not breakeven even, no what am i supposed to do when the best part of me was always you? and what am i supposed to say when i am all choked up and you are ok? i am falling to pieces, yeah i am falling to pieces they say bad things happen for a reason but no wise words going to stop the bleeding because she is moved on while i am still grieving and when a heart breaks no it do not breakeven and what am i going to do (ones still in love while the other one's leaving) (because when a heart breaks, no, it do not breakeven) oh, you got his heart and my heart and none of the pain you took your suitcase, i took the blame now i am tryna make sense of what little remains, ohh because you left me with no love, with no love to my name because when a heart breaks, no, it do not break no, it do not break no, it do not breakeven, no what am i going to do (oh glad you are okay now) (oh i am fallin', fallin') oh, it do not breakeven, no

i have been flicking over stations i have been clicking through the sites read every newspaper but i am still not right in the head no, not right in the head i have been drinking till i am sober i have been getting real high been cutting old wounds and staying up all night again oh, all night again because i want to feel something unreal i want to feel something unreal, yeah yeah, ooh every bone i break, if it is love or hate i want to feel every time i bruise, if it is win or lose i want to feel (something unreal) i have been digging up skeletons i have been turning over rocks but a million more problems is all that i got in the end all i got in the end my heart has been rewired i have been living online there is ideas of living lord but this are not mine, it is pretend lord, oh, it is pretend, yeah i feel it in my fingertips i feel it in my bones the hair is standing on my skin i know that i am home throwing back the curtains and the truth shall be revealed i am praying for, i am waiting for something unreal (yeah)

song: Never Seen Anything Quite Like You
lyrics: i think i want you more than want i know i need you more than need i want to hold you more than hold when you stood in front of me i think you know me more than know and you see me more than see i could die now more than die every time you look at me well i have seen you in jeans with no make-up on and i have stood there in awe as your date for the prom i am blessed as a man to have seen you in white but i have never seen anything quite like you tonight no, i have never seen anything quite like you when it is right it is more than right because you feel it more than feel i could take this moment now ride into the grave with me well, i have seen you in jeans with no make-up on no, i have never seen anything quite like you tonight in your eyes, oh in your eyes in our hearts, yeah in our hearts sometimes words just are not enough for this love that is more than love

did you lose what will not return? did you love but never learn? the fire's out but still it burns and no one cares, there is no one there did you find it hard to breathe? did you cry so much that you could barely see in the darkness all alone well, did you see the flares in the sky? were you blinded by the light? did you feel the smoke in your eyes, did you, did you? did you see the sparks, feel the hope? you are not alone, because someone's out there sending out flares did you break but never mend? did it hurt so much you thought it was the end? lose your heart but do not know when? someone's out there sending out flares.

you have read the books, you have watched the shows what is the best way, no one knows, yeah meditate, yeah, hypnotized anything to take it from your mind but it will not go you are doing all these things out of desperation you are going through six degrees of separation you hit the drink, you take a toke watch the past go up in smoke you fake a smile, you lie and say you are better now than ever and your life's ok well it is not, no first, you think the worst is a broken heart what is going to kill you is the second part and the third, is when your world splits down the middle and fourth, you are going to think that you have fixed yourself fifth, you see them out with someone else and the sixth, is when you admit that you may have fucked up a little no, no there are not no help, it is every man for himself you tell your friends, yeah, strangers too anyone who will throw an arm around you tarot cards, gems and stones believing all that shit's going to heal your soul you are only doing things out of desperation and the third, is when your world splits down the middle oh no there is no starting over without finding closure you take them back no hesitation that is when you know you have reached the sixth degree of separation that is how you know you have reached the sixth degree of separation no, no there are not no help, it is every man for himself (you are going through six degrees of seperation)

song: The Man Who Can t Be Moved
lyrics: going back to the corner where i first saw you going to camp in my sleeping bag i am not going to move got some words on cardboard, got your picture in my hand saying, "if you see this girl can you tell her where i am?" some try to hand me money, they do not understand i am not broke - i am just a broken-hearted man i know it makes no sense but what else can i do? how can i move on when i am still in love with you? because if one day you wake up and find that you are missing me and your heart starts to wonder where on this earth i could be thinking maybe you will come back here to the place that we would meet and you will see me waiting for you on the corner of the street so i am not moving, i am not moving policeman says, "son, you can not stay here." i said, "there is someone i am waiting for if it is a day, a month, a year. got to stand my ground even if it rains or snows. if she changes her mind this is the first place she will go." so i am not moving, i am not moving, i am not moving, i am not moving people talk about the guy that is waiting on a girl, oh ohh there are no holes in his shoes but a big hole in his world, hmm and maybe i will get famous as the man who can not be moved maybe you will not mean to but you will see me on the news and you will come running to the corner because you will know it is just for you i am the man who can not be moved (so i am not moving) (i am not moving) going to camp in my sleeping bag, i am not going to move

better stop dreaming of the quiet life because it is the one we will never know and quit running for that runaway bus because those rosy days are few and stop apologizing for the things you have never done because time is short and life is cruel but it is up to us to change this town called malice rows and rows of disused milk floats stand dying in the dairy yard and a hundred lonely housewives clutch empty milk bottles to their hearts hanging out their old love letters on the line to dry it is enough to make you stop believing when tears come fast and furious in a town called malice, yeah struggle after struggle, year after year the atmosphere's a fine blend of ice i am almost stone cold dead in a town called malice, ooh yeah a whole street's belief in sunday's roast beef gets dashed against the co-op to either cut down on beer or the kids new gear it is a big decision in a town called malice, ooh yeah the ghost of a steam train echoes down my track it is at the moment bound for nowhere just going round and round playground kids and creaking swings lost laughter in the breeze could go on for hours and i probably will but i would sooner put some joy back in this town called malice, yeah ooh in this town called malice, yeah in this town called malice, ooh yeah

sup up your beer and collect your fags - there is a row going on down near slough get out your mat and pray to the west i will get out mine and pray for myself thought you were smart when you took them on, but you did not take a peep in their artillery room all that rugby puts hairs on your chest what chance have you got against a tie and a crest? hello-hurray - what a nice day for the eton rifles, eton rifles hello-hurray - i hope rain stops play for the eton rifles, eton rifles thought you were clever when you lit the fuse, tore down the house of commons in your brand new shoes, composed a revolutionary symphony, then went to bed with a charming young thing hello-hurray - cheers then, mate. it is the eton rifles, eton rifles hello-hurray - an extremist scrape with the eton rifles, eton rifles what a catalyst you turned out to be: loaded the guns, then you run off home for your tea - left me standing like a guilty schoolboy... left me standing like a naughty schoolboy... we came out of it naturally the worst: beaten and bloody, and i was sick down my shirt. we were no match for their untamed wit, though some of the lads said they would be back next week. hello-hurray - it is the price to pay to the eton rifles, eton rifles hello-hurray - i would prefer the plague to the eton rifles, eton rifles eton rifles, eton rifles!

streets i ran - this whole town - backstreets and all - i wanted to leave there. but no matter how fast i ran, my feet were glued, i just could not move there. i saw the hate and lots of people i heard my name called above the noise i tried to speak but my tongue was tied bumped into emptiness and started to cry - oh no i saw the lights and the pretty girls and i thought to myself what a pretty world, but there is something else here that puts me off. and i am so scared dear, my love comes in frozen packs, bought in a supermarket. streets i ran, through wind and rain, around this place amongst streaming sunshine. scared i was, sweating now. feeling of doom, my bowels turned to water. i felt hot breath whisper in my ear, i looked for somewhere to hide but everywhere's closed. i shut my eyes pretend not to be here, this feeling's much to real to ever disappear - oh no. and i am so scared dear, their hate comes in frozen packs, supermarket boy its a tough tough world but you got to be tough with it and i am so scared dear - my love comes in frozen packs

a police car and a screaming siren - a pneumatic drill and ripped up concrete - a baby wailing and stray dog howling - the screech of brakes and lamp light blinking - that is entertainment. a smash of glass and a rumble of boots - an electric train and a ripped up 'phone booth - paint splattered walls and the cry of a tomcat - lights going out and a kick in the balls - days of speed and slow time mondays - pissing down with rain on a boring wednesday - watching the news and not eating your tea - a freezing cold flat and damp on the walls - waking up at 6 a.m. on a cool warm morning - opening the windows and breathing in petrol - an amateur band rehearsing in a nearby yard - watching the tele and thinking about your holidays - waking up from bad dreams and smoking cigarettes - cuddling a warm girl and smelling stale perfume - a hot summer's day and sticky black tarmac - feeding ducks in the park and wishing you were far away - that is entertainment. two lovers kissing amongst the scream of midnight - two lovers missing the tranquillity of solitude - getting a cab and travelling on buses - reading the graffiti about slashed seat affairs -

our land, i love it too i think i love it more than you i care enough to fight if we do not try if we just lie if we can not find a way to do better than this, who will?

poison is bubbling beneath your dream home buried there years before kid runs in crying from playing in the garden "mommy, i burned my hands" what is making our eyes so itchy? do not rub  them, they will swell up oh oh oh oh, it is a big waste dump oh yeah we built your ticky-tacky houses on landfill soil to cover up a gift we left you years before of toxic chemicals and leaking gas just dig a little while, you will find our acid baths cesspools in eden oozing away groundwater's poisoned, air stings like hell the lines for doctors grow long over martinis the company laughs we do not owe you a damn thing but what about all these fainting spells? how did you like a lick from my open sores? and oh... oh oh oh, why are our babies stillborn? a storage tank's leaking, it is about to explode why evacuate when you can watch the fun? nothing happens here, get out the lawn chairs we will drink pink lemonade and watch martinez burn leak by the day the land we sold you is right atop our acid pits we fill them by the truckload in the dead of night there is a thousand more toxic tips of the iceberg we pay a little bribe or we just do not report them and see what you get? in eden no accident, just a little of our greed-fueled negligence so you have found the proof why your cancer rate's shot up what are you going to do when we have got all the cards? times beach, rocky flats, love canal and bhopal merry christmas, hostages, from the folks that care have a nice day

countdown, get ready for the blast off and do not forget the hype, we are going into space distinguished scientists, a pesky senator and monkey turds leaking from the lab all brought to us play by play by howard cosell you are going where no man has gone before do not ask us where that is, we have no idea you are chosen for this great mission because we owe you some favors and besides, you are bright, a little too bright step one, senator, your vomit it is time to analyze it for the folks back home open the hatch, launch the war satellite, that the commies are not supposed to know about our real challenge is to keep it a secret from the press back home because you are healthy and strong and make a lot of fuss especially around us, we like you better when you are far away have you noticed you are going the wrong direction? we have but that is your problem, we planned it that way we had to dispose of all of you so we can spoil the final frontier how dare you question our star wars plans for the farce that they are? for rocking the boat in our temple of doom you are on a one-way ticket to pluto we wash our hands of you and your lost ark so do not forget to write, no no no no no no no no no

cold concrete apartments rise up from wet black asphalt below them a few carcasses of the long-gone age of privacy it takes a scary kind of illness to design a place like this for pay downtown's an endless generic mall of video games and fast food chains one by one, the little houses are bricked up and condemned a subtle hint to move before the rats move in this could be anywhere could be anywhere everywhere those new kids at school seem cool but dad says not to talk to them stick to your old friends, they are not our kind so now there is lots of fights so many people i know come of age tense and bitter-eyed can not create so they just destroy come on, let us set someone's dog on fire empty plastic culture slum, suburbia is a war zone now sprouting the kinds of gangs we thought we would left behind could be everywhere kids at school are taking sides along color and uniform lines my dad's gone and bought a gun he says he is fed up with the crime in this town this could be everywhere this could be anywhere (anywhere) this could be everywhere (everywhere) i hope i am gone before it explodes i linger late at night waiting for the bus no amount of neon jazz could hide the oozing vibes of death my dad's a vigilante now, he is bringing home these weird-ass friends like the guy who fires blanks at his tv when kojak's on or the guy who shows off his sub-machine gun to his sixteen year old daughter's friends whose sense of pride and hope is being in the police reserve

we have reviewed your yellow form congratulations, we find you qualified you have just the right capacity for putting up with our nonsense there is just one thing you have got to prove we know how you must be dishonest and lazy if you are so desperate you actually want to work at this place you must be guilty - lie detector be guilty - lie detector till you are proven innocent these days blood pressure clamps around your arms now do not get nervous when we yell in your face we know you steal, just who do you screw? with what, with who, are not you a christian? the polygraph, do not make it move one little twitch, the anvil drops on you do not matter if you told the truth we want your facial egg for our file proven innocent these days march! ha, ha! guilty - till proven innocent guilty - it says so on your face guilty - when you try to find guilty - a place to live or a job that pays guilty - when you file a complaint guilty - against the cop that kicked your face last night guilty - it says so on page three guilty - who'd think a guy like me would plant drugs in your car? break in your house while you are asleep open your mouth, bet your ass you are watched and it is your word against ours yeah, just because we are hiring you no, that do not mean that we trust you at all you will have to take a test like this once or twice every week we know machines, they make mistakes and it is your word against our dead black box the machine is always right because we know how it makes you feel so small till you are proven innocent because when you are innocent... when you are innocent... when you are innocent it just do not pay

we got a drug we are going to try it out on you will not make you die it will getcha just a little bit sick got a head cold, got a chest cold and it is three days old going on forever make you hazy, make you lazy drive you crazy for days and days and days and days and days and years barely got the time now to stay on the job double up the dosage in your water supply make you even sicker 'til you are slippin' away getting all depressed it is getting all your friends you can not get it up for nothing that'll rock the boat the government flu slip it abroad keep a-slowin' down the ussr but meanwhile we will keep an eye on what it is doing to you for days and days and days and days and days and days and days and days and days and days and days and days and days and days and days and years the government flew through you

well it is been ten years and a thousand tears and look at the mess i am in a broken nose and a broken heart an empty bottle of gin well i sit and i pray in my broken down chevrolet while i am singin' to myself there is got to be another way take away, take away take away this ball and chain well i am lonely and i am tired and i can not take any more pain never to return again take away well i have searched and i have searched to find the perfect life a brand new car and a brand new suit i even got me a little wife but wherever i have gone i was sure to find myself there you can run all your life but not go anywhere well i am sick and i am tired well i will pass the bar on the way to my dingy hotel room i spent all my money i have been drinkin' since half past noon well i will wake there in the mornin' or maybe in the county jail times are hard getting harder i am born to lose and destined to fail

song: Story of My Life radio edit
lyrics: story of my life high school seemed like such a blur i did not have much interest in sports or school elections and in class i dreamed all day 'bout a rock 'n' roll weekend and the girl in the front of the room so close yet so far you know she never seemed to notice that this silly schoolboy crush was not just pretend life goes by so fast you only want to do what you think is right close your eyes and it is past the story of my life and i went down to my old neighborhood the faces have all changed, there is no one left to talk to and the pool hall i loved as a kid is now a 7-11 and i went downtown to look for a job i had no training, no experience to speak of and i looked at the holes in my jeans and i turned and headed back yeah, good times come and good times go i only wish the good times would last a little longer i think about the good times we had and why they had to end so i sit at the edge of my bed i strum my guitar and i sing an outlaw love song thinkin' 'bout what you are doing now and when you are comin' back

running around like you are front page news lonely eyes and your motorcycle boots tattooed heart and your jet-black hair running 'round like you do not care take me down take me on down the line well, i was born, babe, with nothing to lose but the black man taught me how to sing the blues made a little life outta rock 'n' roll and that crazy california hustle and flow shake me down shake me on down the line i went too fast with that rhythm and booze almost ended up dead like all those other fools everyone's got some sort of ball and chain what is life without a little pain? living in a hollywood movie dream and i am still reaching for the stars life gets hard and then it gets good like i always knew it would (on down the line) (down the line)

when i was young, i was so full of fear i hid behind anger, held back the tears it was me against the world, i was sure that i would win the world fought back, punished me for my sins i felt so alone, so insecure i blamed you instead and made sure i was heard and they tried to warn me of my evil ways but i could not hear what they had to say i was wrong self destruction's got me again i realized now that i was wrong and i think about my loves, well i have had a few i am sorry that i hurt them, did i hurt you too i took what i wanted, put my heart on the shelf now how can you love me when you do not love yourself i was wrong, yeah i grew up fast, i grew up hard something was wrong from the very start i was fighting everybody, i was fighting everything but the only one that i hurt was me i got society's blood running down my face somebody help me get outta this place how could someone's bad luck last so long until i realized that i was wrong the only one that i hurt was me

well i am a gangster in 1934 junkies, winos, pimps, and whores and all you men, women and kids best stay out the way i just left your town took all your loot wore a pink carnation and a pinstripe suit a hopped up v8 ford and some two-tone shoes and i am already gone i left a pool of blood and sorrow i have got the machine gun blues i will be out of here before the break of dawn hit the highway smoke a big cigar going to stop and bury the cash then get some more there is only one thing on my mind that is makin' across that ol' state line amid a hail of avenging bullets that are meant for me i left a path of pure destruction already done my life will soon be though i am public enemy number one i am sorry for all the things that i have done if indeed we do cross paths it is nothing personal i left a trail of devastation already gone

it was a moonlight mishap you lost your party hat seems your lifestyle are not so worthwhile, after all a heavy-hearted taxi ride then a walk on the wild side did your guardian angel let you down? going to lay low and play it straight it is time to rejuvenate going to kick start your heart until you come around i can tell you now you have really gotten the blues that i have walked in your shoes give me the sweet and lowdown you better get outta the way it is history made the hard way from a hero to a zero once again are not no time for vanity or this insanity you are maladjusted and now you are busted once again it comes as no surprise by that look in your eyes you are looking kinda punch drunk because that is the way you strut your stuff with a swing and a swagger, down the road you go you shoulda made a better choice and listened to your inner voice you got to get right or get left, do not y'know it is the peak of bad news the sweet and lowdown give me the sweet

take me down that line going to tow that heavy load i can not seem to make it make it on my own turn the lights down low now turn down our bed i can not seem to get you out of my head stranded here in bakersfield you are so close yet so far, far away you are a million miles away, yeah i feel the heat coming down now sweat runs down my face i can hardly fake it go fake it through this day was it something that i said or something i did not do eighteen more hours, girl 'til i am home to you so i walk out that lonely truck stop with my head hanging down wondering how in the hell i got myself into this mess and more importantly how i was going to get myself out of it so i wrote a song for you, baby girl and i hope when i return home the locks are not changed on the doors and there is still a spot for me on that big ol' california king size bed will not you come see me in bakersfield? ooh i am not a million miles away yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah

there was a time when you were proud you looked up to me with big eyes and i could do no wrong there is something inside, that is clearly tearing both of us apart ooh ooh, there is something inside i wonder where you are tonight and what you did with your day can not find the words to say did you feel the sun? did you feel the warmness of my heart? ooh ooh, did you feel, at all? they say if you love someone you got to let them go and if they return to you that is surely how you will know ooh ooh, i can read the writing on the wall ooh ooh, but i can not let go i am hopelessly aware of the good and the bad traits we share it is like looking at myself and i know that at times i could have handled things differently ooh ooh, but know my intentions were well

[chorus x3] you are not right, you are not never going to be

song: The Separation of Church and Skate
lyrics: hey kids! hey dad! what do you want to do today? we do not know! do you want to go to the matinee? no! do you want to go to the amusement park? do you want to go to the punk rock show? yeah! let us go to the punk rock show! lost in a sea of combat boots, flush the bouncers with wasted youth when did punk rock become so safe, when did the scene become a joke the kids who used to live for beer and speed now want their fries and coke cursing and (flipping) birds are not allowed, in fact let us keep noise levels down must separate the church and skate why do not we put pads on the kids, helmets, head gear and mouth pieces then we could pad the floors and walls, put cameras inside bathroom stalls we make sure only nice bands play, make every show a matinee teach kids to be all they can be, and we could sing my country 'tis of thee sweet land of liberty, bleh! when did punk rock become so safe i know it was not duane or fletcher, who put up the barricades like a stake in the heart, somehow we got driven apart i want conflict i want dissent, i want the scene to represent our hatred of authority, our fight against complacency stop singing songs about girls and love, you killed the owl you freed the dove confrontation and politics replaced with harmonies and shticks when did punk rock become so tame, these fucking bands all sound the same we want our fights we want our thugs, we want our burns we want our drugs where is the violent apathy, these fuckin' records rated g when did punk rock become so safe?
