in the darkest tunnel, it is nice to see a light not just a headlight like the one that is heading right for me. it would be nice if things could turn out right turn out right yeah do not think i will ever see the day. i must have done something wrong or maybe pissed off god. i think of chinese food when i think of life that is sweet and sour my life is sweet as saccharine. you know 3 week old milk and grapes are not not the same, no i am the one johnny carcinogen. i must have fucked with some witch in turn she cursed me, cursed my life. at the end of the longest line that is where i will always be if you need to find me, just go to the end of the longest line. but officer that was a yellow light the light was red, son insubordination, reckless driving i must be wrong, this can not be right i do not belong, this world is much too dangerous for someone lacking luck, like me. the end of the longest at the end of the longest, line.

the leads are weak fucking leads are weak you are weak remember when america had a middle class and an upper class that was way before the exodus that was the america that we thought was number one thought would overcome, thought would never die that was just our pride and faith two shitty deadly sins i know faith is not one of  them, but it should have been because some things are crumbling we have no camaraderie, just a faith someone would save us form despondence we called it america, woooooah "number one america" was the slogan used to keep moral up when we knew we were already cooked then the richer western states succeeded in secession and the eastern ones followed right behind mexi-can-america was the perfect name that epitomized the order significance, authority and affluence, we had turned it all around went from number one straight to number two (shit) national bankruptcy circumcised society usa dined and ditched fox reports "poor is the new rich" we called it america

breathe ever so soft we would not want to break the eggs as we walk never alone, cautious, afraid i hear the voice of reason on the p.a. leave it alone, follow the grain we could not stop the irresistible force leave it the same, change with the leaves bringing in the sheaves, bringing in the old leave it alone da na na na na na na na naa breathe, ever so slight we could not take away your god given right leave it alone, heal and stay roll over and shake and beg for the bone

song: What s the Matter With Parents Today
lyrics: mom and dad, how did you get so rad? when exactly did you get so hip? wearing teenage clothes you are always coming to my shows and telling me that i should mellow out it is absurd, they are singing every word you are not supposed to like my band things i like you do not understand so please put down that rum and coke that is not behavior for old folk can we just hang on holidays dad and mom, what planet are you from? and what convinced you to pack up and leave doing drugs and asking me for hugs what is the matter with parents today? not again when will it end? dad's dressing like motley crew and why is moms hair dyed bright blue? and stayin' out till two or three then having sex analy i thought the apple fell far from the tree mom and dad, i think you ought to quit smoking so much pot and hanging with my friends laying round, on the couch with my misfits records out softly banging your head maybe its just a passing phase what is the matter with my parents these days?

the bouncers with wasted youth when did punk rock become so safe, when did the scene become a joke the kids who used to live for beer and speed now want their fries and coke cursing and flipping birds are not allowed, in fact let us keep noise levels down must separate the church and skate when do not we put pad on the kids, helmets, head gear and mouth pieces then we could pad the floor and walls, put cameras inside bathroom stalls we make sure only nice bands play, and we could sing my country 'tis of thee sweet land of liberty when did punk rock become so safe i know it was not duane or fletcher, who put up the barricades like a skate in the heart, somehow we got driven apart i want conflict i want dissent, i want the scene to represent our hatred of authority, our fight against complacency stop singing songs about girls and love, you killed the owl you freed the dove confrontation and politics replaced with harmonies and shticks when did punk rock become so tame, these fucking bands all sound the same we want our fights we want our thugs, we want our burns we want our drungs where is the violent apathy, these fucking records are rated g

this is not a test of the emergency broadcast system, this is the real thing! kick back watch it crumble see the drowning, watch the fall. i feel just terrible about it that is sarcasm, let it burn! i am going to make a toast when it falls apart. i am going to raise my glass above my heart. then someone shouts, that is what they get. for all the the years of hit and run for all the piss broke bands on vh-1. where did all their money go? do not we all know? parasitic music industry as it destroys itself. we will show them how it is supposed to be. music written from devotion not ambition, not for fame. zero people are exploited there are no tricks, up our sleeve. were going to fight against the mass appeal. were going to kill the seven record deal. make records that have more than one good song. the dinosaurs will slowly die and i do believe no one will cry i am just fucking glad i am going to be there to watch the fall! pre-historic music industry three feet in la brea tar. extinction never felt so good. if you think anyone will feel badly you are sadly, mistaken. time has come for revolution fuck collusion, kill by five. whatever happened to the handshake whatever happened to deals no-one would break what happened to, integrity. it is still there, it always was for playing music just because a million reasons why dinosaurs will die dinosaurs will die.

does anyone know how loaded he was when he unloaded his gun? when the slaughter had begun? does anyone know how crazy he was? does anyone think he did it because he thought humans were in season? his brain had a lesion? is it worth it? and did not he have any reason? does anyone know what number of pint he was planning to spill? does anyone think he may have been prescribed the wrong happy pill? which got him to kill all the infidles the intellectuals, the homosexuals even the red-neckxuals everything can start making sense when it is (in)printed out of context does anyone know what made him decide to unload his first round? do you think he cared what race or faith for the victims he left for dead on the ground? does anyone know how jewish he was? does anyone know how buddish he was? does anyone know how if he is a christian? had a pot to piss in (?) did he consider it a sin? did anyone go to church for the dead? and asked in knee and pray how can you believe in a god and still carry a card of the nra? i thought religion is supposed to instill a notion that is not right to kill it must be a bitter pill to admit that you are all mentally i will why do we have a hard time when there is no enemy to blame it does not matter how many were killed the debate is the same is it alright to ... judge you for fun is it protection we need from the gun the blame is always placed on someone it is always how the story is spun only a lunatic would sell a lunatic a gun

friday night we will be drinkin' maneshevitz going out to terrorize goyim stompin' shagitz, screwin' shicksas as long as we are home by saturday mornin' because hey, we are the brews sportin' anti-swastika tattoos oi oi we are the boys the orthodox, hasidic, og ois orthopedic dr. martens good for waffle making, kickin' through the shin reputation, gained through intimidation pacifism no longer tradition oi oi, we are the brews the fairfax ghetto boys skinhead hebrews we have got the might, psycho meshuganas we can not lose a fight as we are the chosen ones chutzpah driven, we battle then we feast we celebrate, we will separate our milk plates from our meat oi oi, we are the brews oi oi, we are the boys orthodox, hasidic, og ois c'mon you schmucks one more time for hershel we are the brews we are the brews

i do not want to defeat you i do not want to be sad i do not want to forgive you i do not want to be mad because it is always say what you wanted to say as you are walking away and i can not take this disappointment again and i am waiting i do not want to be near you i do not want to be far but i wanted to start and i can not take this silent treatment again for you yes it is always say what you wanted to say and i can not take this silent treatment again and i am waiting, and i am waiting

no more waiting on them, as you rise inside new rooms, its official, you have gone, you can live for no-one else, man the guilt must be huge, there is no gain in failure, you succeded at being mine, yeah, old friend, see ya there, i will be proud from a far, i can not paint a picture, in a moment, of memories there is not many left, i am extrodited, uninvited. it is just another saturday. take a step to freedom, you and her loathing this cruel world, take a breath of shelter, then exhale, trust and allegance, liberate yourself from hell.

she broke up with me, two days later... i think she met don juan in italy, she has a new man, i have a new mustache. now all my friends are going to call me mountain man, and everyone will think that i am a stupid drifter to walk the earth alone, i will never shave again. on the night she left me, facial hair grew miraculously, i dressed in black like johnny cash, and grew this beard of shame. i have heard it said she looks a lot like sherilyn fenn, and some times i am mistaken for billy gibbons, look like a wise man, but i am an idiot. it is over, she left me, and she will soon forget me, she found out i was lame, i grew a beard of shame. come all ye faithful, joyful and triumphant, i am a new man, i have a beard of shame.

through the straw the liquid pulls down, down, down it goes toward the bottom through the icy terrain we are almost there, keep sucking commiserate, our shared disgrace the ole handshake, reciprocate downplay it or embrace it something we can choose one blank stare into infinity everything to lose the nihilist runs in retreat his apathy born in defeat yeah, life is fleeting and hope is bittersweet a consequence we can control or a dangerous animal oh oh trying is the first mistake cut  them loose, amputate disconnect, breakaway or inhale and aspirate nothing left to lose the absence of a love affair the disconnected without care yeah, life is fleeting and is not always fair consequence out of control makes a dangerous animal

i thought the west was won but seems like i had just begun to lose all ideals i once knew mountains and transmutation anxious anticipation these sodden skiey and burning views short goals and grim objectives soon rising seas will take your homes benchmarks and sure salvation creation and temptation black lungs sing vituous hate songs antibiotics and disinfectants germaphobes for stronger infection cowboys on steroids love tabloids expecting endless surplus soon they will have nothing left to waste racing from dogma to distrust unsure why they all hate us think about it the world defines you think about it you should be depressed and no little pill will make any difference people for atto seconds bow to the idiocracy media spun reality nightmares comes every shut-eye still they will not see what they become still they will not see what they have done power mad mass corruption blood money changes everyone wake each day in panic and distrust knowing that they all hate us think about it the world describes you think about it you should be anxious and no little pill no little pill will make any difference

where do we begin when there is a sin a dog that we name dogma the cat we will not forgive we would go outside to play but it is not safe today brother's eyes watering urge grown-ups sigh imaginary words but they would not desert me they would not desert me they will never hurt me we will run away and find our safe place somewhere to stay animal, order of control the last sapien in rule implement the plan inherited indoctrination fails you the clan will fall oh, imposed identities oh, your viewpoint narrowing oh, to she would formality oh, oh, oh the leap from certainty start a fire, abruptly we conspire subdividing just as soon uncontrolled, the flash mob uncontrolled a flash-fire briefly fueled by rage or wrath oh, reality now dull oh, the image more beautiful oh, the scandal society of ritual truth burning they will not desert me and find our safer place

skid row, marginal. some will call it home emptied for the art walk while the missions close pop-up tent cities abounding birthing scant displaced humanity as we diversify we spill from cities beyond the wealth crest traditional boundaries everything meant to burn. thirty-year cycles mud pots, sandstone bluffs, crumble and erode fault lines, fortitude small streets swell into grand avenues as we devalue debtors of the dream living oblivion skin-deep sun-seeking life in the construct that is sold promised land, golden state, sunny, blissful no longer affordable surviving california

highway run into the midnight sun wheels go round and round you are on my mind restless hearts sleep alone tonight sending all my love along the wire they say that the road are not no place to start a family right down the line it is been you and me and loving a music man are not always what it is supposed to be oh, girl, you stand by me i am forever yours faithfully circus life under the big top world we all need the clowns to make us smile through space and time always another show wondering where i am i am lost without you and being apart are not easy on this love affair two strangers learn to fall in love again i get the joy of rediscovering you i am still yours ever yours

here he is, he saves a grin he wants to be the one who does not have to sink a level indiscrete, in his retreat all he needs is just a taste of the bitter pride he held in her name embrace the solitude of ordinary fucked up state of grace far away from the days he bared the cross she used to wear in some resolve well aware a little pitiful, a pin up boy they dress in grieving wear well at ease in consent in the drift of undertow he will not justify the pity from them when he knows... fools in love are arrogant their sermons cloud his breathing air he is in love with an isolation from emotion here he is awaiting sentence a fool to think that anyone can escape guilt and anguish a subtlety that can not be learned a subtlety that can not be taught he is caught in the lure of second thoughts he might still care as he settles down well aware bound in secrecy. his voice will only dignify their fears but sorrow is signified he is well aware of his pride

what is another word for fuck? sound to incite, tone to give up everything we are in tenor drift no more than air and spit machines that move in entitlement is not it rich? is not it queer? maybe next year can you cite which ones abused? those without choice, those in costume identity of the afflicted mind they want their name on that sign longing to be oppressed stealing light is not it sick? is not it lit? unlike the opportunist victim aligned finally verified we are still alive oh, to stamp out the meek our common enemy off with their heads our words are all the evidence we need with chosen marks we deviate, transformed as if these marks resemble those inborn.

a city's molten gold the native rite of desperation affordable and safe words once in love now separated another auld lang syne to your bullpen more vacancies my friends let us do this! cracks in wet asphalt stress fractures cave-in to craters structural downfall leaking life dad is a failure everything in this sinking building broke the bread-and-butter choke oh, no... jini, jini, i lost my head can not pay the rent, can not mend the fence the life we built in the home we made where ownership it means nothing if we leave, we will never be able to return from landlock we could breathe within our means stable for the long-term trade-off it is only a version of you with a distorted world view the fear of the unknown imprisons you can not mend the fence, can not pay the rent ownership means nothing our ownership, it means nothing

goodbye my dearest foe here's to fledging teen sorrow today forgotten, tomorrow is a promise to be broken we should not prolong what seems right until it is wrong one more sad so long one more dear john letter i am not afraid to step into this grave it is not enough no it is not enough i wanted to live long enough to regret the billy clubs and lament the gateway drugs see the first missteps through wisdom in a round room fit for battered clowns we agree the circus freaks are buttoned-down i am not afraid to step down from the stage

i am just another fool and i have to keep telling myself that i am just a hypocrit and i have to keep calling you one and i forgot to bite my tongue as my assumption is the mother of all mistakes so i assume the role open my mouth and clumsy words escape so why you, want to be there? when you could be here you are slippin' away i awake with your replacement a bottle in my grasp in an unfamiliar place because you put me out the butt of your sick joke into this ashtray life as you come and go because i forgot to service you and we broke down and you can not live with my mistakes so i assume false grace open my arms and grasp at something true how are you how have you been girl i miss you want to see you again oh why you want to be there? girl i am sliping away i bring out the worst in you and you try to let me know you bring out the worst in me anxiety, anxiety i am trying to let you go you say i am giving you the creeps open my claws and grasp for your heart into you like a mortal stake so vindictive violins i am trying hard to let you go (violins)

imaginary hope. panacea colonies on dope. anesthesia this is how we cope without wonder blind empiricist. incompliant pseudo scientist. feigning science the fascinated minds outnumbered we will understand dark matter when we can build a weapon from it but if we dream beyond the five-sense fishpond beauty and awe is natural law pillars of creation in the stars while we are all counting cars cells regenerate before our eyes while superstition thrives they contaminate poisoning debate emotion is their because and effect conspiratorial. illusionary desire for control. imaginary stimulated to arrogance the universe is not obligated to make sense to them or to you if we dream beyond carry on

all our lives in fast pursuit smash and grab like thieves posterity. what will you leave behind? consigned life, a humbling disease believe devoted road, the places you will go all the people you will know crossroads resolve your actions and your deeds echo for eternity foresee want for contact, need for insight the unbearable pity for the suffering how do you express yourself? how do you tell the truth? surrounding you, the darkest points of view suffer in their toxic feedback loop hostage devoted road, the places i have travelled all of the people i have known high roads full of doubt and certain of nothing concede how humbling my life has been begin want connection, hunt for knowledge the unbearable lacking for the suffering it is not unusual to lose hope it is common to become unhinged i am giving in, i am giving in let it begin. the suffering

look at the world in disbelief you used to follow, now you lead college has enlightened you and you are proud to be different and like different bands, different types you are not nobody's fool it is like certain bands remind you of someone you hated because they did not wear the right clothing and there is only one true fashion a lot of the bands on the college charts are great bands until they get signed, then you hate them it is such bullshit you used to love them, you hypocrite know it all, know it all did you really listen to that song? could you ever write what you call wrong? i remember you and i listening to bands that we liked only the songs mattered to you but now you are a d.j. and preaching that hype corporate rock sucks, you know college radio enlightens you it is supposed to serve as a means to expose new bands without prejudice, but it makes no sense safe harbor for the underground 'til the alternative becomes the popular sound the bands are good 'til they make enough cash to eat food and get a pad then they are sold out and their music is clichã© because talent's exclusive to bands without pay know it all

and it is prejudiced as he controlled to be this way to make it different so he would take one summer morning he left us ashamed in some small town of small ways the one they feared they might turn to stone they feared to hold his hand and he died alone he died alone alone! do not leave them on an island of shame your solution you homophobic, you coward you send them away to an island of misery you are not immune to any disease i can not argue when the truth is plain to see in your beliefs, your fear of death i see reflections of society we will take our last breath alone open your eyes, it is all inside adding insult to injuries because deep inside where truth then hides it is not that kind he was alone it is prejudiced yes it is prejudiced they like to stab him in the back

uncertainty a foundation built on nothing i could see secure in your immaculate perception the last resort i thought i would ever exercise now, all that i have to stand on grieving from a different point of view i learn its meaning from you in life and death and continue ...but faith is just a silent tribute mine is just a desperate act give him back i owe him throw me a line, i will suspend my disbelief and concede following your lead faithfully led into this concession with hope and doubt a seemingly futile gesture my faith is just a silent tribute holding on it is just this desperation that takes me home

it is been awhile, but somewhere in each day i recall that crooked smile, last few years to calculate all the ways i could have changed your fate and my role forever know the toll of still blood one more song one more visit to the cell where i belong a hundred stories hanging on fifteen songs that hanging from each line goodnight i recall the last song and i can not handle brooklyn anymore but always long for one more sunrise knowing you are safe at home i picture life but then the vision jumps away like the touch of death could see my name my cell, forever know the devil in details a wrinkled page, scribbled word a melody gone will never be heard this one's writing itself god help, what god? one song, my aeroplane forever over the sea goodbye i can not write this sad song long, and they will not share the first line anymore but always long for one more song tony, we will always long for one more song always long for one more

she is a girl dressed in black from another world lives and breathes like a girl from another world she do not know my name (she do not know my name) she do not have the time of day celebrate, medicate 'til we numb the pain in this storm it is still dark, like it always rains she do not feel the same (she do not feel the same) and i wait, and i wait, and i wait, and i wait, and i wait, and i wait and i wait for her i do not care what you say, no i do not care what you do i am going to the darkside with you she is a girl i look back to what could have been her cloak and dagger mouth tastes like medicine she will not last the night (she will not last the night) spun out in the neon light you would leave, but you need me to numb the pain you are possesed and you slept through another day you do not feel the same and i do not have the strength to stay i am going to the darkside...

song: Every Time I Look for You
lyrics: never found out why you left him but this answer begs that question too blind to see tomorrow too broke to beg or borrow. young and stupid, left wide open hearts are wasted, lives are broken one more point of contention, i need some intervention approached with vague intentions betray my short attention span the distance, bridge the border beg forgiveness, round the corner everytime i look for you the sun goes down and i stumble when this whole thing runs aground i left another message, you are never around but everytime i look for you the sun goes down once more will the last one out, please shut the door more time apart will give you a few more months to argue is this to much to live through it always seems to far to drive the point home, send more letters pray tomorrow, ends up better i never did do anything that she asked i never let what happened, stay in the past i never did quite understand what she meant in spite of everything, in spite of everything but everytime i look for you the sun goes down

i never thought i would die alone i laughed the loudest who'd have known? i trace the cord back to the wall no wonder it was never plugged in at all i took my time, i hurried up the choice was mine i did not think enough i am too depressed to go on you will be sorry when i am gone i never conquered, rarely came sixteen just held such better days days when i still felt alive we could not wait to get outside the world was wide, too late to try the tour was over, we would survived i could not wait 'til i got home to pass the time in my room alone another six months i will be unknown give all my things to all my friends you will never step foot in my room again you will close it off, board it up remember the time that i spilled the cup of apple juice in the hall please tell mom this is not her fault i never conquered, when you came tomorrow holds such better days days when i can still feel alive well i can not wait to get outside the world is wide, the time goes by the tour is over, i will survive i can not wait 'til i get home

lyrics: i do not really like myself without you every song i sing is still about you save me from myself the way you used to because i do not really like myself without you i really wish i hated you a little drunk, waiting on your phone call a little numb, maybe i can not feel at all you stitch me up, but you can not stop me bleeding out i am better when i am broken i love you, but i hate you when you are with someone else i do not want you wrapped around me, but i do not trust myself i drove by your house, but you do not live there anymore save me from myself, the way you used to i really wish i hated you right now will not you say something? the sun is out, i am dying in the daytime i think about the future that we left behind i drank it all, but i can not shake you from my mind now every window's broken i can see that you have had enough i can see that you are giving up on me i can see that your hands are up i hate the way that you are better off, better off i numb the pain but it never stops, never stops wish i could say that i am better off, better off now but i do not really like myself without you

oh no, it happened again she is cool, she is hot, she is my friend i would try for hours if so you leave me nowhere to go she is unstoppable unpredictable i am so jaded calculated wrong please take me home too late, it is gone i bet you are sad this is the best time we ever had i hope, hope that it lasts give in, forget the past be strong when things fall apart honest, this breaks my heart why did we have to go date? it is too easy to complicate (be strong when things fall apart) (it is so hard...) let us go!

perfection is my direction even if that is all i had it is not like i need no correction i just know that life's not so bad picture this everyday, kids that just can not find a way stuck in disarray, can not find hope for better days it is the degeneration of childhood frustration in the last 30 years teenage suicide has increased 300% in north america it is the second major because of death in canada when will all my problems disappear? am i just going crazy from the fear? oh my, oh my, i am going far past the brink this pressure's like a weight and i still can not think straight i have met my destinations what is left to complain about? all these aggravations building till the seams fall out i am running my mouth dry with every time i lie but do not tell me without a doubt this dumbfound luck has all run out (do not tell me without a doubt) (this dumbfound luck has all run out)

i will never take part in the growing population or waste my time with further education forget what we know it is just a big show what they want to control so jaded, frustrated its all so complicated fashion, no passion surrounds me all i know is i have heard this all before reality's a bore you ask me to believe in something fake well i can not bring myself to do what you want me to this is who we are and nothing's going to change i can not take part in the businessman illusion i will take my chance in the real world confusion do not blame us who do we trust when they are so dishonest no patience, this nation's obsessed with exploitation lying, denying surrounds me do not think you can ignore us do not tell me that we are to blame do not pick our future for us or act like we are the same (thanks for nothing) it will never be the same and nothings going to change...

lately i am not quite myself maybe i do need some help just my confusion trust my delusion do not you regret you met me go through these steps to get me back to where we start 'fore i fall apart if i could black out it would become so clear standing face-to-face with everything i fear watch so closely but still i do not see as bad as it seems a piece of mind i steal an ordinary life but consequences real i am past the point of reality this is not me this is not you when it is just everything we do till you open up your eyes and understand this is not real this is everything but true till we come to realize is what we put each other through.l it is like a bad dream, coming all so true leaving me with nothing else left to do now so helpless i am not so selfish tell me, how does it feel to have a face like that how does it feel to be replaced like that now so faceless do you still feel till you open up your eyes and understand this is not real is what we put each other through it is hard to believe right now this seem to be real still phasing by this time so why can not i wake up

some say we are never meant to grow up i am sure they never knew enough i know the pressures will not go away it is too late find out we are different somehow it is too late to even have faith do not think things will ever change you must be dreaming think before you make up your mind you do not seem to realize i can do this on my own and if i fall i will take it all it is so easy after all believe me because now's the time to try do not wait, the chance will pass you by time's up to figure it out you can not say it is too late seems like everything we knew turned out we are never even true do not trust, things will never change you must be dreaming, dreaming... some say we are better off without knowing what life is all about i am sure they will never realize the way somehow it is different everyday in some ways it never fades away seems like it is never going to change i must be dreaming believe me, it is alright

there is no doubt in my mind when it is over, what is done will be you will find when life gets colder there is no sympathy there is no point trying, you can not escape the bitter end well, who will greet you when you are at the bitter end all your choices chosen, you have got no say, your decisions made face your consequences as your life begins to fade as time keeps spinning closer to the bitter end slip take a look at yourself, time keeps racing, is all you have come to be what you expected, are you still chasing possibilities because all your prayers will not save you from the bitter end the bitter end the bitter end soon

pull the curtain, begin, paranoia's wearing thin now it is wearing thin now (where did i go wrong?) close my eyes, realize i have become the victimized now desensitized now the one and only day has come i will pay for all the bad things i have done something's wrong because i find the glamour in the dark side in the dark side cheap regrets, can not forget falling victim to the debts still unpaid in my mind it is going to take me, you do not know tragedy i have been to hell and back again to tell it close my eyes and lay me down to sleep i fear the worst, my beating heart ticks to explode and my time is up so why can not i just sleep?! living dead awake, the horror show begins so pull the curtains over me (bring on the panic, the uncontrolling manic) it is a free-for-all, kill them all every last one of them, i do not care every last one of you, i do not care suffocate the dreams in my mind (i can not stop believing) drown the thoughts that have me confined (stop this heart from bleeding) gutter dreams as black as the night () no one told me empathy's a lie (lost in paranoia) (my last words i am choking) (are all my dreams broken?) (the silence is deafening) (my ears will not stop ringing) now we are gone, do you still feel the same? well now, can not you see i need help to stop me from myself? well, can not you help me now?

while looking for the answers only questions come to mind because i have been lost in circles which seems now for quite some time and i do not know how i came here, even how i got this far all i can tell you is my fate is written in the black stars well, what am i supposed to do? bless myself this perfect hell of my own is the best i have ever known tell me something i do not want to know because i can not believe it is so what am i supposed to do? i have become sick of everyone now and i do not feel remorse for all forgotten and i do not care at all! and i do not pray to voice of all the problems oh oh oh take me away i am sick of everyone today i am not ok but i am fine this way i need no change so take me away i am coming down, i fell apart it is hard to keep together when you do not know where to start and i do not feel remorse for the forgotten and i do not care of all! and i am the patron voice of all the problems i am sick of everyone!

oh, rescue me oh to be blessed with this godless mistake one one day you soon will find (just a warning) you are going to pay for the abominations it is only matter of time i wait, i hope, i pray for better days they seem so few and far between the fear, the pain, this hate's it is not for me we are not so different, can not you see? your lies will tear you apart will take you alive will not spare you at all i tell you all your lies will tear you apart i am calling all to arms so everyone and all it is time hear your voice you have got the right (oh, rescue me) you better pray for your commiseration you are almost out of time your fate is left to a different generation you know they will not be kind you take this hate and package it to sell to victims of your great divide you have no ca-pa-city to even feel i hope you get this through your mind it is time to hear your voice because now i will not let you just break me in two there is no way that i would give in those words that you say of hate and dismay will lose you your place in the end i will tell you all your lies will tear you apart

i never told you how i felt though i thought i would said it all and i never knew you needed help well, because you always seemed so tough but now i am here alone without you by my side if only i had known that you kept it all inside now i am trying to understand just trying to find a way but forgive you i just can not it is all just to much for me to take and if i failed you, well, i swear i tried my best but now you are gone, so all your tears can lay to rest just so you know you meant the world to us, i know that it is too late and all i want's another chance, i can not accept that you have left look at all this damage done are you happy with yourself? and we thought the best was yet to come and i thought i knew you, oh, so well and the days just go by while the moment seems to last like catching fire all is gone, and it all went up so fast and now you are gone, so all your tears can lay to rest that you have left but all i want's another chance, i can not accept that you have left

i addressed this letter to dear father i know you as complete unknown i guess it is better you do not bother all our truth should be left alone be left alone i learned the things you never showed me took the chances you would have blown and to this day, the one and only you remain a complete unknown complete unknown you are out there somewhere i do not know if you care at all it seems that you do not it is as if the day will never come so you remain a complete unknown (unknown, unknown, unknown, unknown, unknown, unknown, unknown, unknown) so many years have been ignored you have been gone without a trace i am getting used to knowing you are just a name without a face without a face so you remain a complete unknown addressed this letter to dear father i do not know if you care

do not know what you really got it is hard to stay and not pretend can not make sense in what you thought it seems i can not comprehend i am happy to be only all that you see and i am not one to learn to be the same i do not want to hear you bitch, no more i was better off a year before no matter how i try, i can not ignore every time i think my brain gets sore when i am with you what is so hard about good-byes? i am sorry, i am just not as keen on planning out our perfect lives when i am only 19 i do not want to try and just be friends nothing's going to change my mind again if ever there were thoughts i had, they are dead i can not even think inside my head i am on my way can not you see that is the truth? so long, can not stay will not you see that is the truth? will not you see that is- see that is the- see that is the... last that i could take because it is getting really hard to fake it is not like it is my problem that you are late but can not you just spare the lies i hate?

well, if you say it is better off this way it is time that i let you go it is been on my mind for days and well, the truth's i already know what you have done and where you have been i know exactly every move you make it is time that i give up on our mistakes and i do not want to be stuck inside a memory i do not want to keep it is hard to believe when all you find in every word is more deceit so do what you will and go on and play the game as straight as you keep your face but tables turn, you just might find that i will say i am turning away because i feel like i can not go on while we are living in this lie and when all of my faith is gone i do not even want to try there is nothing that you could say that could ever change my mind and with all of these steps i take and it is giving me back my life it is giving me back my life

lyrics: Oh, oh (Oh-oh-oh) oh (Oh-oh-oh) oh (Hey, yeah) (let us go) Yeah, yeah, uh We started off a team Party 'til we fall asleep Even on the street, when we disagreed We did it on beat (Did it on beat) Expected unique (Right), anything less, it was weak The music of the strings made life complete (Facts) 'Til that one day they changed everythin' The pop trolls started snatchin' up all of the strings (Oh no) Put the melodies on top of popular beats They cut us out of the scene And then forgot what it really means (Not even publish us) Shoulda seen between all of the scheming It seems like the trolls they stole from were meaningless Walkin' around like they were the geniuses But it is only samples, autotune and remixes (No, lawd) I am a vegan, I do not have no beef with  them (No, lawd) got to protect my kingdom But the dream is to sing again (Yes, yes) Being friends, seamless blend Harmony are not hard when the keys within you win First, it was all love (At first, it was all love) Hands up, super star love (Stars up) That you can have it, you can have it all, love (And you can get it how you want) But then you took it, took it all, love (They took it all) All, love Turn it up louder (Turn the music up louder) Sing along, get the crowd up (Get the crowd up, come on) But then you took it all, love (Took it all, love) Then forgot all about us (Oh), but it is all love I feel you Sounds good in my ear when I hear it like that I say I look good to the mirror and it says it right back A little love would not kill you You really did me wrong, it was real cruel (It was real cruel) Had a lot of love and I still do because I feel you Next morning, the elders were on me (Man) They saw the warnin' signs, could not ignore it (Look) Had to figure out how to save the way of life they had made So they made a play The pop trolls were comin' for it all (Ah, ah) All for one and one for all (Ah) So the only way we saw, how we saw it It was one thing left to be done (What?)

song: Try Sleeping With a Broken Heart
lyrics: Even if you were a million miles away I can still feel you in my bed Near me, touch me, feel me And even at the bottom of the sea I could still hear inside my head Telling me, touch me, feel me And all the time, you were telling me lies So tonight, I am going to find a way to make it without you Tonight, I am going to find a way to make it without you I am going to hold on to the times that we had Have you ever try sleeping with a broken heart? he is trying to divide us, this shit's like a cult But like Johnny, he will only unite us 'Cuz nothing drives us inside like this fight does Similar to when two cars collide 'cuz our spirits are crushed And this spot's a tight one But here the jaws of life come to pull us from the wreckage that is what we get pride from When we can not from our stars and stripes cuz This type of pickle we are in is hard to deal But there is always tomorrow still If we start from the scratch like a scab for scars to heal And band together for Charolettesville And for heaven's fallen heroes Fill his wall with murals Hit the damn reset, start from zero This is our renewal, spray tan get rid of Get a brand new, better, America And here's to where we are from This is where it all began, all began (stand up) Here's to the land that made me And made me who I am, who I am (hands up) Here's to the land that raised me there is hope for the only place that really knows me From the cracks in the road that drove me there is no place like home did not want to piss your base off, did ya? can not denounce the klan, 'cuz they play golf with ya You stay on Twitter, way to get your hate off, Nazi I do not see a way you all differ, at all And all you got are race cards but get A swastika with your name carved in it Should be your trademark, because hate's all you played off And you just think it played off, So I guess it pays to feed off the chaos So basically, you Adolf Hitler But you are not ruining our country, punk Or taking our pride from us You will not define us 'Cuz like a dictionary, things are looking up So much, got a sprained neck Know we can rise up Against this train wreck and take a stand Even if it mean sitting when they raise the flag This are not the Star Spangled Banner This man praised a statue of General Lee, because He generally hates the black people, degrades hispanics Take it back to the Shady national convention Wish I would have spit on him before I went to shake his hand at the event Or maybe had the wherewithal to know that he was going to try to Thought he was going to tear apart a sacred land We cherish and stand for, so Hands in the air, let us hear it for The start of a brand new America Without him, we can be proud of where we are from I will not give up I will not give up on my home, that so many died for You already know that I will not give up You already know there is no place like home, no place like home Wherever I go, no place like home No place like home, no place like home Wherever I go there is home for the only place that really knows me
